loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 57 years old and lives in Sumasap, Panaon. She is single with no children. 
To earn a living, Ruth has a business selling snacks and viand (food dishes). She earns about PHP 5000.00 each month doing this type of work. Ruth has a requested a loan to be used in purchasing more snacks and viand.
Ruth has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Ruth would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more snacks and viand (food).

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a single and has seven children who attend school. She runs a restaurant, which he has been doing for three years. She works seven days a week from her home but on retail basis. She generates additional income through selling charcoal.  

Hellen is requesting a loan for 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO, which she will use to buy bananas, Irish potatoes, beef, beans, and ground nuts. Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality. She hopes to expand her business so that she owns a fully stocked restaurant and can educate her children up to university. She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, beef, Irish potatoes, beans, and ground nuts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Rolia

texts.en: Rolia is married with one child. Rolia is 45 years old and resides at Kapalaran, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines. Rolia owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living and she's been 5 years in this business. Each month, she earns 8,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand product offering. In 2011, Rolia joined GDMPC. In the future, Rolia wants to build house and to see her child finish studying.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his movie room by buying more DVDs and CDs

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband, who is a vegetable and fruit seller. With the loan investment, he will put fresh seasonal fruits and vegetables in his shop and that will allow him to attract more clients towards his shop and increase his sales and income.

Shazia is a seamstress and sews clothes to financially support her family. She has 6 sons and a daughter. 5 of them are studying while the remaining 2 are not of school-going age. She is very positive in her thinking and confident that the loan will be a productive one for her husband and will improve his income.

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Shazia.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for fruits and vegetables selling business

loans.name: Alsie Lee

texts.en:
Alsie Lee is 34 years old and lives in Salimpono, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. 

To earn a living, Alsie Lee has a business selling dried fish. She earns about PHP 5000 each month doing this type of work. Alsie Lee has requested a loan to be used in purchasing more dried fish stocks for sale.

Alsie Lee has been a member of PMPC for one year.  In the future, Alsie Lee would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish stocks for sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 41 years old and a business lady. She is married to Peter who is a businessman. They are blessed with two children. She has been in the farming business as a primary business and running a retail shop as a secondary business for the past two years with the monthly income of KES. 8,000.

She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Mary will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer and restock her retail shop. With the anticipated profit from the two businesses she will buy a dairy cow. 

Her hopes and dreams are to educate her children up to university level and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer and restock her retail shop.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is from Bajo, Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old. Evangeline is married and has six children. To make a living, she manages a retail business where she sells a variety of home products and food products. She has been in her business for 15 years and earns PHP 12,000 a month from these activities.

 In 2010, Evangeline joined GDMPC. Evangeline is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Silvestra

texts.es:
Silvestra es una mujer de 29 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su pequeño hijo, ella es una mujer muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lastimosamente por diversas razones se separó de su pareja, desde entonces ella es padre y madre para su pequeño y ha tenido que trabajar desde muy joven para poder solventar sus gastos, lamentablemente por tal razón no ha podido estudiar la carrera de Enfermería que tanto quería; en sus ratos libres le gusta dedicar un poco de tiempo a la lectura y en algunas ocasiones cuando visita a sus padres cocina un riquísimo Ají de Gallina para compartir con su familia.	
Gracias al apoyo de su hermana, quien siempre ha estado a su lado, desde hace 2 años Silvestra puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes y comida, día a día desde tempranas horas de la mañana ella inicia su labor y puede dedicar un aproximado de 12 horas diarias a su negocio, ella se siente a gusto con su trabajo y cree que le va bien por que atiende amablemente a sus clientes.
Silvestra se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un mostrador y mercadería, tales como: arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, galletas, golosinas, entre otros, de esta manera Silvestra podrá contar con su negocio mejor abastecido y acondicionado, con ello espera poder aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales en un futuro no muy lejano desea utilizar para poder asegurar la educación y bienestar de su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Silvestra is a 29 year old woman who lives in the city of Pisco with her young son.  She is a very friendly, enthusiastic, hardworking woman who dedicates all of her efforts toward getting her family ahead.  Unfortunately, for various reasons, she separated from her husband and since then she is both the mother and father to her young son and she has had to work since she was very young in order to earn the money to pay expenses.  Sadly for that reason she was not able to study to become a nurse as she always wanted to.  She likes to read in her spare time and likes to cook a delicious garlic chicken to share with her family whenever she visits her parents.

Silvestra began her business food and grocery business 2 years ago, thanks to encouragement from her sister, who has always been by her side.  Daily she begins working very early in the morning, and dedicates 12 hours a day to her business.  She feels comfortable with her work and believes that things are going well because she is friendly when she serves her customers.

Silvestra is very grateful for the Kiva loans and thanks to the help she’s gotten she has been able to buy and a display case and merchandise, such as rice, sugar, milk, noodles, cookies, and snacks, among other things.  In this way Silvestra will be able to improve and better supply her business and hopes to be able to increase her sales and income.  In the near future she hopes to be able to provide for her son’s education and well-being.

loans.use: to buy a display case and merchandise.

loans.name: Richie

texts.en:
Richie is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Richie has a shop that sells vegetables, dried fish, canned goods and spices. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of dried fish, canned goods, vegetables and spices.

Richie has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Richie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, spices, dried fish and vegetables

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Corazon requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy tools and equipment for her sewing machine.

She has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Corazon would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Roselyn is providing motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.

Roselyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Roselyn hopes to improve her services.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline

loans.name: Tanja

texts.en:
Tanja is from Kosovo. She lives in a Serbian community. She is a widow and she is raising three children; the oldest is 12 and youngest 9 years old. All three of them go to school. Tanja is a regular client of KosInvest. Tanja is a hard-working woman. She works hard for her children and they are her reason to keep going. She owns a boutique for selling clothes. She has been running this business for five years.

She started with a small store selling clothes and by taking loans from KosInvest, her business has expanded, and she is planning expand it further. Tanja’s business is the main source of income for her family. She requests a loan to buy clothes for selling.

Tanja is very thankful for this help.

Her goal is to save money to ensure a better education for her children.

loans.use: To buy clothes for selling

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 49 years old and a business lady; she is married to Stephen, who is employed as a civil servant. She has been in the farming business for the past 30 years with the monthly income of KES 20,000 which she uses to support her family.   

She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Ann will use the loan to pay school fees for her child. 

With anticipated profit from the farming business she will boost the farming by buying seedlings. Her hopes and dreams are to build her own house and improve the family's living standard.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is married and a mother of four dependents. She is 49 years old and lives in Oroquieta City. Evangeline owns and operates a motorcycle transport business. She established the motorcycle transport business as a way of generating extra income of 7,600 PHP per month. She has been engaged in this type of service for 20 years. 

Evangeline requested a loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. She intends to use the money from the loan to purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories. Evangeline been a member of GDMPC just since this year. In the future, Evangeline wants to purchase more motorcycles to use in her business.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Juana Mercedes

texts.es: Doña Juana habita  en la comarca de la Borgoña del municipio de Ticuantepe junto a sus hijos quienes la apoyan  economicamente  ya que trabajan por que son mayores de edad. y ayudan a su madre siempre en los gastos del hogar, ella trabaja como domestica en una casa privada de un residencial y  en estos momento quiere seguir construyendo su sueño. terminar su casita. con este nuevo financiamiento podra comprar los siguientes Materiales: Ceramica para el piso, Puertas de madera, Cubetas de pintura y un inodoro. gracias a este credito sus condiciones del hogar mejoraran ya que es un beneficio para toda la familia.
texts.en: Juana lives in the Borgoña área within the town of Ticuantepe.  She lives with her adult children who work and also help her financially and with the household expenses.  She works as a cleaning woman in a private home and would like to continue building her dream of completing her little house.  This loan will allow her to buy the following materials: ceramic floor tiles, wooden doors, paint, and a toilet.  Thanks to this loan, her living conditions will improve and it will benefit her whole family.

loans.use: to buy home improvement materials.

loans.name: Jhonatan

texts.es:
Jhonatan tiene 23 años, es un joven con muchos deseos de salir adelante, trabajador y empeñoso. Es soltero, vive en la casa de sus padres en compañía de sus cinco hermanos, a quienes quiere mucho y se esfuerza por ser el orgullo de su familia.

Se dedica al transporte público. Todos los días conduce su motocarro por las principales calles de la ciudad en busca de pasajeros. Trabaja en este oficio desde hace 4 años y le va muy bien; gracias a su trabajo ha podido juntar un capital y establecer desde hace un año otro negocio, que es la venta de gaseosas al por mayor y por unidad. En la casa de sus padres tiene una congeladora para enfriar sus bebidas y venderlas al gusto de sus clientes. Para esta actividad también requiere del uso de su motocarro para el transporte de las cajas de gaseosa hasta el domicilio de sus clientes y es por eso que algunas piezas de su vehículo no están funcionando en óptimas condiciones y requieren ser cambiadas. Los ingresos económicos que tiene le permiten apoyar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar además de darle libertad financiera. Su deseo es convertirse en un próspero empresario, pero por el momento está viendo los buenos resultados que está teniendo como mototaxista y desea tener una flota de motocarros.

Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, por lo  que se siente agradecido con el apoyo financiero que está recibiendo, ya que esto le servirá para avanzar con su trabajo. Además, afirma sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal, pues considera que sus integrantes son personas amables y solidarias.
El monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de los accesorios y repuestos que necesita para reparar su motocarro. Otra parte del dinero lo usará para comprar más cajas de gaseosas.
texts.en:
Jhonatan is 23 years old, and he is a hardworking and persevering young man with a great desire to progress in life. He is single and he lives in his parents’ house with them and his five brothers whom he loves very much, and he works very hard to be the pride of his family.

He offers public transportation services, driving his motorcycle every day along the streets of his town, looking for customers. He has been engaged in this activity for 4 years and things are going very well. Thanks to his job he has succeeded in saving enough money to start another activity about one year ago: he sells sodas at wholesale prices and by the unit. He has a freezer in the house of his parents where he freezes the sodas he then sells to the liking of his customers. He needs his vehicle to carry out this activity as well, in order to transport soda crates up to his customers’’ houses; as a consequence, some parts of his vehicle are not in optimal conditions and needs to be substituted. His earnings allow him to help his parents paying for their household expenses, on top of granting him financial freedom. He wants to become a successful entrepreneur, but considering the good results he is obtaining as a moto-taxi driver he now plants on owing a fleet of motorcycle taxis.

This is the third loan he is requesting to MFP and he feels deeply grateful for the economic support he is receiving as this will help him progress with his activity. He also says he likes his Communal Bank because he thinks its members are kind and caring people.

A portion of the 1500 PEN he has requested will be invested in the purchase of accessories and spare parts he needs to repair his motorcycle. He will use another portion of the loan to buy more soda crates.

loans.use: To buy accessories and spare parts to repair his motorcycle and to buy more soda crates to sell.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 22 years old and has a common-law husband with two children. Christina works very hard to provide for them.

Christina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

Christina has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, eggs, cooking oil and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future, Christina would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is 53 years old, married and the mother of six children. She earns a living as a farmer, while her husband is a businessman. She has been a farmer for the last five years and earns KES 8,000 a month. She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD, after repaying her first loan successfully. Nancy will use this new loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm and a pig to rear. She will use the profits she expects to earn to pay for the education of her children. Her dreams for the future are to do large-scale farming and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Shakir

texts.ru: Shakir yavlyayetsya IDP personom, pereselenec iz Fuzuli kotoriy yavlyayetsya okkupirovannimi territoriyami.On seychas jivet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Shakir ochen lubit svoyu rabotu, on lubit obuchat detey. Shakir uje 13 let kak rabotayet uchitelem v shkole. Shakir nujdayetsya v 1000 AZN chtobi kupit  nujniye knigi i testi dlya detey. Eto yego vtoraya ssuda Shakir ochen blagodaren Lenderam i Kive za pomosh. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Shakir 43 qoda.
texts.en: Shakir is an IDP from Fuzuli, which is considered an occupied territory.  He currently lives in the Absheron region together with his family.  Shakir loves his work very much and loves teaching children.  He has been working as a school teacher for 13 years.  Shakir needs 1000 AZN to purchase necessary books and tests for the children.  This is his second loan, and he is very grateful to the lenders and Kiva for the help.  Shakir is 43 years old, married and has two children.

loans.use: to purchase necessary books and tests for the children

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa is 30 years old, married and the mother of four children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines, and is requesting a loan for PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more items to sell to her customers. She has been in her current line of work for six years, and sells a variety of items to her customers, including soap, canned goods and other groceries. In the future, Elsa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Floricita

texts.en: Floricita works hard to support her family by making copra, or dried coconut kernels. She is married, and has been in her current line of work for 10 years. She is requesting a loan for PHP 15,000 from NWTF to buy more coconuts to use for making copra. Her goal for the future is to build and expand her business so that she can give her family financial stability.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts to use to make copra.

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es:
Marcos, vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos quienes están estudiando, se dedica a la pesca industrial desde hace tres años y también se dedica a la agricultura, esta actividad la aprendió a través de su familia y hasta el momento ha sido su fuente de trabajo para el sostenimiento del hogar.

Solicita un préstamo para compras de hierro, cemento, alambre, tablas, que son las necesarias para hacer algunas reparaciones en la vivienda, ya que no está en buenas condiciones y quiere que su familia cuente con una mejor condición y con mayor seguridad, este préstamo le ayudara a poder realizar el trabajo requerido.

Su objetivo es mejorar la construcción de la vivienda, trabajar a través de la pesca y la agricultura para poder hacerle frente a las obligaciones del hogar y así mismo poder generar una condición adecuada.
texts.en:
Marcos lives with his wife and their four children, who are in school. He has been working in industrial fishing for the past three years and he also works in farming. He learned this business from his family and until now it has been his source of work to support his household.

He is requesting a loan to purchase iron, cement, wire, and planks, which is what he needs in order to make some repairs in his home, since it is not in good condition and he wants his family to live in better conditions and more safely. This loan will allow him to perform the work that needs to be done.

His goal is to improve the construction of his house and to continue his work, fishing and farming, so that he can meet his responsibilities at home and, at the same time, provide adequate conditions.

loans.use: to purchase iron, cement, wire, and planks.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en: Liza is 27 years old, married and the mother of three children, all of whom are in school. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and is requesting a loan for PHP 12,000 from NWTF to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs. She has been in her current line of work for 10 years, and has taken out and repaid four previous loans from NWTF. In the future, Liza would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy medicine and vaccines for her herd of pigs.

loans.name: Macrina

texts.en: Macrina is married and works hard to support her family by selling vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years, and is requesting a loan for PHP 25,000 from NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers. Her goal for the future is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Soyibnazar

texts.ru:
Сойибназар житель района Кубодиен. Он холост. Сойибназар ответственный и трудолюбивый молодой человек. Он живет вместе с родителями. Ему 26 лет.
Сойибназар зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Животноводством он занимается уже два года. За два года он получил не плохую прибыль от купле - продажи скота, также он купил быка за счет полученной прибыли. 
Сойибназар берет кредит для закупа двух коров, чтобы увеличить поголовья крупного рогатого скота.
texts.en: Soyibnazar is a resident of the Qubadiyon district.  He is single.  Soyibnazar is a responsible and hardworking young man.  He lives together with his parents.  He is 26 years old.  Soyibnazar earns a living by breeding cattle.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for two years.  During these two years, he made a decent profit from buying and selling livestock and bought a bull from his profits.  Soyibnazar is requesting this loan to buy two cows in order to increase the cattle headcount.

loans.use: to buy two cows

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Манзура женщина в возрасте 45 лет. Манзура замужем имеет  3 детей, ее старшие сыновья находятся в Российской Федерации, дочь замужем. Манзура счастливая бабушка  3 внуков. Манзура сотрудничает с нашей организацией с 2003 года. Она торгует на рынке мужской одеждой. Раньше она работала учителем в  местной школе так как у нее заработная плата была очень маленькая она решила заняться бизнесом.Этот бизнес дает очень хорошую прибыль. Также Манзура помогла свой дочери открыть точку по продажи  тканей  для пошива женской одежды.На полученный кредит хочет привезти сезонную мужскую одежду и расширить свой бизнес. Манзура благодарна за финансовую поддержку и надеется на дальнейшее сотрудничество с Арванд.
texts.en: Manzura is a 45 year-old woman.  She is married and has three children.  Her older sons are in the Russian Federation, and daughter is married.  Manzura is a happy grandmother of three grandsons.  Manzura has been partnering with our organization since 2003.  She sells men's clothing at a market.  Previously, she worked as a teacher at a local school, but because her salary was very low, she decided to get involved in business.  This business yields a very good profit.  Also, Manzura helped her daughter to open a retail outlet to sell fabrics for sewing women's clothing.  She wants to use this loan to bring in man's seasonal clothing and expand her business.  Manzura is grateful for the financial support and hopes to continue the partnership with Arvand.

loans.use: to purchase men's clothing

loans.name: Mutabbar

texts.ru:
Мутаббар проживает в городе Худжанд. Ей 52 года. Она замужем. Мутабар живет с мужем. Сын Мутаббар работает в Российской Федерации. Ее муж занимается торговлей.
Мутаббар хорошая портниха. Она у себя дома занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Мутаббар любит свое дело. В этой области она более восьми лет.  
Мутаббар хочет заняться шитьем свадебный национальных платьев с вышивками. Для этого ей необходимо приобрести швейную машинку и много других необходимых вещей специально для вышивки. 
Мутаббар берет кредит для покупки ниток, материалов, тканей, бисера, камушек, ленточек и приобретения швейной машинки.
texts.en: Mutabbar lives in the city of Khujand.  She is 52 years old, married and lives with her husband.  Mutabbar's son works in the Russian Federation.  Her husband is involved in sales.  Mutabbar is a good seamstress.  She is involved in sewing national dresses at home.  She loves her work.  She has been in this business for over eight years.  Mutabbar wants to get involved in sewing national wedding dresses with embroidery.  To do this, she needs to purchase a sewing machine and many other necessary things especially for embroidery.  Mutabbar is requesting this loan to purchase threads, materials, fabrics, beads, stones, ribbons and a sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase threads, materials, fabrics, beads, stones, ribbons and a sewing machine

loans.name: Melkin Yobany

texts.es:
El señor Melkin tiene 30 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa, tiene 3 hijos, reside en una Comunidad rural del Municipio de Santa Cruz de 
Don Melkin desde hace 20 años se dedica a la agricultura, produciendo piña y Yuca.  Esta actividad la realiza desde niño  ha tenido toda la experiencia para dedicarse a este cultivo, el cual lo vende en el mercado local de la ciudad y también para exportar. Melkin con los financiamientos que anterior mente ha obtenido le han ayudado en la inversión para sus cultivos.
Actualmente para seguir dándoles la asistencia necesaria ha solicitado otro préstamo de 12,000 para la compra de fertilizante  y seguir mejorando la producción del producto, por lo que espera obtener mayores ingresos, aprovechando los precios altos que se registran a nivel internacional. 
Para mantener un nivel de vida mejor y que sus hijos continúen estudiando.
texts.en:
Sr. Melkin is 30 years old. He and his wife are in a common-law relationship and have three children. They reside in a rural community in the town of Santa Cruz.

Don Melkin has been farming for 20 years, producing pineapple and cassava. He has been in this line of work since he was a boy, so all of his experience has been dedicated to producing crops. His products are sold at the local market in the city, but they are also exported. With the previous loan he obtained, Melkin has been able to invest in his crops.

In order to provide his crops with the needed attention, Melkin is currently requesting another loan in the amount of 12,000 HNL so that he can buy fertilizer and continue improving his crop production. He hopes to generate more income and take advantage of the high prices being commanded on an international level so that he can maintain a better standard of living and help his children continue their education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a computer and university expenses.

loans.name: Gulru

texts.ru:
Гулру проживает в городе Истаравшан. Ей 43 года. Она замужем. Ее муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Дочь Гулру портниха.
Гулру имеет среднее образование. Она занимается животноводством. Более трех лет Гулру занимается этим видом деятельности. Она берет кредит для закупа телят.
texts.en: Gulru lives in the city of Istaravshan.  She is 43 years old and married.  Her husband works in the Russian Federation.  Gulru's daughter is a seamstress.  Gulru has a secondary education.  She is involved in animal husbandry.  Gulru has been in this business for over three years.  She is requesting this loan to buy calves.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Nueva Oportunidad Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “ Nueva Esperanza” está conformado por 17 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de ropa, venta de madera, venta de leña, joyas, perfumes, venta de pan amasado, servicios entre otros. Todos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Talca.
Claudia delegada del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en primera fila, ocupando el tercer lugar de  izquierda a derecha, viste una chaqueta de color blanca con franjas de color rosado, su cabello es de color castaño claro y lo usa tomado.
Ella se dedica al rubro de la amasandería y confección de cojines y cortinas de baño, desde hace 6 años. Comenta que trabaja acompañada en la parte de confeccionar los cojines de lunes a domingo, y en la tarde se dedica a la venta de amasandería específicamente en queques, calzones roto (son un dulce típico de Chile, compuesto de una   masa frita  hecha de harina, polvos de hornear, azúcar flor y huevos. Esta comida se sirve generalmente en invierno), su horario de trabajo lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.   Su mercadería la compra en supermercados y distribuidoras donde encuentra de todo para su amasandería y confecciones a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará para su amasandería específicamente harina, huevos, aceite, azúcar, margarina.
Las metas de Claudia son poder perfeccionarse aún más en el rubro de la confección ya que lleva menos tiempo realizando este rubro.
Claudia vive junto a su hija de 9 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel personal son terminar sus estudios ya que pudo llegar solamente hasta octavo año de Liceo.
Ella está muy contenta  y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades e intereses.
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “ Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope).  It is made up of 17 entrepreneurs who makes their livings in different lines of work including clothing sales, wood sales, firewood sales, jewelry, perfumes, loaf bread and services, among others.  They all live in the city of Talca.
Claudia, the representative of the communal bank, is in the first row of the photo.  She is the third from the left, wearing a white jacket with pink trim and has light brown hair worn in a ponytail. 
Claudia makes her living baking, making cushions and making bathroom curtains.  She says that she works with others making the cushions, which she does from Monday to Sunday.  And in the afternoons, she sells her baked goods, specifically cakes, and "calzones roto" (a Chilean sweet made of fried dough.  It uses flour, baking powder, powdered sugar and eggs and is usually served in the wintertime).  Claudia's work schedule is divided according to her availability.  She purchases her merchandise from supermarkets and wholesalers that offer everything she needs for her baked goods, cushions and curtains at low cost, which makes it economically advisable. 
With this loan, Claudia will make purchases for her baked goods, specifically flour, eggs, oil, sugar and margarine.
Claudia's goal is to get even better at making the cushions and curtains, as she hasn't been doing it for as long.
Claudia lives with her 9-year old daughter.  Her dream for her personal life is to finish school, as she was only able to attend through her eighth year of primary school.
Claudia is very happy about and grateful for the opportunity Fondo Esperanza has offered her to invest in her business.  In addition, she feels very comfortable with the other entrepreneurs in the communal bank; they share with each other their different businesses and interests.
Talca belongs the Maule Region, which is located in Chile's central zone.  It constitutes the administrative, economic and cultural center of the region.  It is the most important city in the Chilean Central Valley.  There is a funny saying in Chile about Talca, the phrase "Talca, París, y Londres."  (Talca, Paris and London).  Among the rumors, it is said that the phrase is a derivation of one originally said by an Englishman "Talca parece Londres" (Talca seems like London) because of the abundant fog that frequently covers the city in wintertime, just like in the capital of the United Kingdom.

loans.use: to make purchases for her baked goods, specifically flour, eggs, oil, sugar and margarine.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a rice retail business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 22,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stock of rice to sell.

Marcelina has been in this business for seven years. She earns additional income from selling fish and raising livestock.

Marcelina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem makes sofa covers. She is very talented and supports her husband in his sofa cover business. She has given birth to two sons and two daughters. Only her eldest daughter is able to get an education.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan investment he will buy a better variety of thread and cloth. This will help him prepare better quality sofa covers and increase his sales and profits.

He is a veteran in this business and has been operating it for many years. Naseem is hopeful that the loan investment will help him earn more profits from his business and she will be able to send her remaining children to school.

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Naseem.

loans.use: To buy cloth and thread for making and selling sofa covers

loans.name: Rufa

texts.en:
Rufa is 55 years old and married with ten children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Rufa is borrowing 22,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and farm supplies.

Rufa has been farming vegetables for 12 years and also earns additional income from raising livestock and from a restaurant.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farm supplies.

loans.name: Giancarlo

texts.es:
Giancarlo es un hombre de 30 años, se encuentra felizmente casado, él vive con su esposa y su pequeño hijo en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago, gracias al apoyo de sus padres Giancarlo pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de computación, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver televisión junto a su pequeño y en algunas ocasiones prepara un riquísimo Ceviche para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, desde hace 3 años Giancarlo puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de reparación de computadoras, diseño gráfico, tipeos y fotocopias; él dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y puede atender a un promedio de 30 clientes; adicionalmente Giancarlo cuenta con 2 mototaxis las cuales alquila a otros choferes para que las trabajen; él se siente a gusto en su negocio y cree que le va bien ya que sus clientes lo recomienda por su rapidez y buen trato.
Giancarlo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de llantas nuevas y podrá darle el mantenimiento general a sus mototaxis; de esta manera Giancarlo contará con sus vehículos en buenas condiciones para poder seguir utilizándolas como fuentes de ingreso, ya que con dichas ganancias espera poder asegurar la educación y bienestar de su pequeño.
texts.en:
Giancarlo is a 30 year old man.  He is happily married and lives with his wife and small son in the city of Ica of the Santiago district.  Thanks to the help from his parents, Giancarlo was able to study the technical field of computing.  In his free time he likes to watch television with his little one and once in a while prepares a very tasty ceviche to share with his family.
Three years ago, with a lot of work and enthusiasm Giancarlo started a small business of computer repair, graphic design, printing and photocopy.  He works in his business about 10 hours a day and can take care of an average of 30 customers.  Giancarlo also owns two moto-taxis which he rents to other drivers.  He feels good about his business and believes that it is going well since his customers recommend him for his speed and good service.
Giancarlo is very thankful to the lenders from Kiva, since thanks to their help he will be able to buy new tires and will be able to provide routine maintenance to his moto-taxis.  This way Giancarlo can count on vehicles in good condition which he can continue to use to bring in income.  With his income he hopes to assure the education and well being of his little one.

loans.use: to purchase tires and to provide general maintenance of his moto-taxi.

loans.name: Jorge Adalberto

texts.es:
Jorge, vive con sus hijos y su esposa, se dedica a la venta de sandía, trabaja junto con sus hijos realizando la venta de este fruto, él realiza la compra de la produccion de sandía, hace la inversion con los agricultores que se dedican a sembrar para poder venderla, este negocio tiene ya dos años de existir.

Solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra toda la produccion de sandía a sus proveedores,  ya que esto le permitira continuar realizando las ventas manteniendo su negocio, ya que asi los agricultores le dan mejor precio a venderle toda la cosecha que hayan tenido, este préstamo le ayudara con los recursos económicos que actualmente no posee.

Su objetivo es trabajar con Su familia para obtener los ingresos necesarios de los cuales logrará cubrir sus necesidades económicas.
texts.en:
Jorge lives with his children and his wife.  He makes his living selling watermelons.  He works together with his children to sell the fruit.  He purchases the watermelons from the producers.  He invests with the farmers who make their livings growing the crop for sale.  Jorge has had his business for two years.

Jorge is requesting the loan to be able to purchase the entire watermelon production from his suppliers.  This will allow him to continue selling and to maintain his business.  The farmers give him a better price when they can sell him their entire crop.  This loan will help him to have the financial resources that he does not currently possess.

Jorge's objective is to work with his family to obtain the income they need to cover their financial needs.

loans.use: to purchase watermelons.

loans.name: La Luz Del Mañana Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “La luz del Mañana” está conformado por 19 emprendedores que se dedican al rubro del comercio, específicamente venta de ropa, venta de alimentos, verduras, feriantes, almacén, pastelería, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillán.
Tusnelda, presidenta del grupo del Banco Comunal quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en primera fila, ocupando el cuarto lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste blue jeans y una chaqueta cuadrille de color café claro y usa una cartera de color rojo, su cabello es de color castaño claro y lo usa tomado.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio específicamente  a la venta de ropa de casa específicamente sabanas, desde hace 5 meses. Comenta que trabaja todos los días y se ubica generalmente en las ferias y su horario de trabajo lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
Su mercadería usualmente la compra en la ciudad de Santiago en distribuidoras a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito Sus metas son continuar con el negocio, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Tusnelda vive sola, ya que sus hijos son grandes y formaron su familia. Sus sueños a nivel laboral son poder instalar un local establecido para una mejor atención a su clientela.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades e intereses, lo cual le ha servido como un momento de distracción. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
The name of this communal bank is La Luz Del Mañana. It comprises nineteen entreptreneurs who work as merchants, specifically selling clothing, selling food, vegetables, in markets, at a warehouse, a bakery, and offering other services. They all belong to the city of Chillán.

Tusnelda is the president of the communal bank group. In the picture, she is the fourth person from right to left standing in the first row, wearing blue jeans and a light brown plaid jacket, and carrying a red purse. She has light brown hair and is wearing it up.

She has been working as a merchant, particularly selling housewares, specifically sheets for the past five months. She says she works every day and generally sets up shop in the markets. She organizes her business schedule according to her availability. She usually purchases her merchandise in the city of Santiago, from low-cost distributors, which is consequently more convenient financially.

Her goals for this loan are to keep the business going so that she can generate more income and have access to a better quality of life.

Tusnelda lives alone, since her children are adults and have started their own families. As far as work, her dream is to be able to open an established business so that she can offer her customers better service.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza has given her, because it has allowed her to invest in her businesss. She also feels very comfortable in the company of her fellow entrepreneurs at the communal bank group, since they all share different activities and interests, which have served as a moment of leisure. As far as the trainings she has attended, she has learned to better manage her business. 

Chillán is a town in the southern area of central Chile. The name means "chair of the sun" in mapudungun, the language of our indigenous people, the mapuches. Chillán is known as the "cradle of the country" and a "land of artists," because many prominent characters from the history of Chile were born here, such as the famous pianist Claudio Arrau, for example.

loans.use: to purchase sets of sheets.

loans.name: Crecencia

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of seven children, Crecencia works hard to support her family.

She has a candle manufacturing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Crecencia is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy wax, coloring materials, wicks and containers molds for her candle business.

Crecencia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy wax, coloring materials, wicks and containers molds for making candles

loans.name: Bosiljka

texts.en:
Bosiljka is a married woman. She is from Kosovo and she lives in a Serbian community. She has one child, who is three years old. Her husband is a driver who drives school children. Bosiljka is the owner of a food shop. She has been in this business for seven years. She really enjoys what she does.

She has many plans for her business, but for the time being, only wants to gather enough capital to expand it. Bosiljka is requesting the loan in order to buy foodstuff for her market.

She is very happy for the financial support that KosInvest gives her, because this way she is certain of making progress in her work.

loans.use: To buy foodstuff for her market

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
La señora Dina tiene 48 años de edad, es viuda con cinco hijos. Desde hace un año ella instalo una tienda de productos básicos en su casa, con un préstamo que la Fundación le otorgo, ya lo cancelo y hoy esta solicitando otro para incrementar el negocio.

Los productos que necesita los adquiere en una ciudad que esta a veinte kilómetros de distancia de su casa, realiza dos viajes al mes y aborda un solo autobús, la compra la realiza al por mayor, debido a que le sale más barato.

El préstamo lo solicita para comprar fríjol, maíz, arroz, maicillo, golosinas, gaseosas, sorbete, entre otros más, con el objetivo de surtir  su negocio y mejorar el servicio a sus clientes. A manera de comprar en mayor cantidad los productos que más demanda tienen generando mayores ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. De las ganancias recibidas, ella pretende seguir invirtiendo en el negocio y realizarle mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
Señora Dina is 48 years old, a widow and has five children.  One year ago, with a loan granted by Fundación Paraguaya, she opened a general store in her home.  She paid back the loan and is now requesting another in order to expand her business.

Señora Dina acquires the products she needs from a city that is 20 kilometers from her house.  She makes two trips a month and only needs to take one bus to get there.  She makes her purchases wholesale because it's less expensive for her that way.

She is requesting the loan to purchase beans, rice, sorghum, sweets, sodas, sherbet and other items with the goal of stocking up her store and improving the service she offers to her customers.  Buying the most requested items in greater quantities generates a greater income so she can improve her family's quality of life.  With her earnings, Señora Dina plans to keep investing in her business and to make improvements to her home.

loans.use: to purchase beans, corn, rice, sorghum, sweets, sodas, sherbet and other items with the goal of stocking up her store and improving the service she offers to her customers.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina works hard to support her family. Josefina is married and has a bakery business in the Philippines.

Josefina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her bakery.

Josefina has been in this business for 5 years now, and also earns additional income from her sari-sari (variety) store.

In the future, Josefina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her bakery.

loans.name: Sandra Marina

texts.es: Doña Sandra, tiene 44 años de  edad, vive en Santa cruz de Yojoa con su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Ella tiene su propia fuente de ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. Tiene varios años de haber establecido una pulpería donde vende productos lácteos, embutidos, granos básicos, harina, azúcar, arroz, manteca etc. El negocio ha crecido un poco pues ya invirtió un préstamo anteriormente y ahora solicita el segundo préstamo que es por 10,000.00 Lempiras, para comprar productos y surtir el negocio. Esta inversión le ayudará a incrementar su inventario y sus ventas. La meta es seguir trabajando para darle el estudio a sus hijos y que el negocio crezca  para obtener más ganancias
texts.en:
Doña Sandra is 44 years old and lives in Santa Cruz de Yojoa with her husband and four children. She has her own business that helps to sustain her family. Several years ago, she established a grocery store where she sells dairy products, sausages, basic grains, flour, sugar, rice, lard, and other items. Her business has grown a little bit since investing her previous loan.

Sandra is now requesting her second loan in the amount of 10,000 HNL so that she can buy products to restock her business. This investment will help to increase her inventory and her sales. Her goal is to continue working so that she can provide for her children’s education and grow her business so that it can generate more profits.

loans.use: to buy food products for her store.

loans.name: Las Frutillitas Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento LAS FRUTILLITAS  está  compuesto por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un varón, la presidenta del  banco es la Sra.  Ángela vive por la zona El Carmen,  La Sra. Ángela tiene 30 años y tiene tres hijos que son de las edades de 10, 12 y 18 años,   se dedica a la venta de variedad de artículos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio que se encuentra en la misma zona donde vive,  este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Angela  va a usar este préstamo para la compra varieda de productos para surtir su negocio como abarrotes y refrescos  y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Ángela va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando productos y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener un almacén y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela. La Sra. Ángela es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras del grupo ya que en muchos casos son personas que sacan adelante solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The communal bank Las Frutillitas comprises eight members: seven women and one man. The president of the bank is Ángela, who lives in the area. Ángela is thirty years old and has three children, who are ten, twelve, and eighteen years old. She works selling a variety of essential goods at her neighborhood store, which is located in the same area where she lives.

This will be her first loan cycle with this institution. Ángela  is going to use this loan to purchase an assortment of products to stock her business, such as groceries and soft drinks, so that she can offer product variety to her customers. The reason she is requesting this loan is to keep improving her business. Ángela will use her profits to keep buying products so that she can gradually improve her income. Her wish is for her business to include a stockroom so that she can offer her customers better service. 

Ángela is a very hard worker. She is happy with the opportunity she is being offered, along with her fellow members, because in many cases they are people who are raising their families alone.

loans.use: to purchase assorted products to stock her business, such as groceries and soft drinks.

loans.name: Kurskhan

texts.en: Mr. Kurskhan is 55 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a private house in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia.  He's a very hardworking person. His wife helps him in his business, and his children are students at college and high school. He started vegetable growing, livestock raising and taxi service businesses in 2006 and is still running them. He produces 15-20 liters of milk per day from his cows. The price per liter is at 1200 MNT currently. He is working to expand the vegetable growing business. He's requesting 5,000,000 MNT to purchase a car and seeds to harvest more vegetable crops.

loans.use: to purchase a car and seeds to harvest more vegetable crops

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania is married with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Epifania is 49 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Epifania has a business selling legume sprouts in the Philippines. Epifania requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more legume sprouts to sell.

Epifania has been in this business for two years. In the future, Epifania would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more legume sprouts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise to start a clothing business.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is 45 years old and married with four children.  With one child in school, Aurelia works very hard to provide for them.

Aurelia runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Aurelia has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, detergent and other groceries. 

In the future, Aurelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 59 years old and married with eight children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosalinda is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosalinda has been raising pigs for 23 years and also earns additional income from raffia making.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Afuwa

texts.en:
Afuwa is married with five children and four of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She has a hardware business. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of cement and nails.  She doesn’t have any other income generating activity. 

Afuwa sells to all categories of people, retail, and has been in this business for five years. Her major business challenges includes transportation and thieves.  She is aspiring of owning a fully stocked hardware shop and also educating her children up to university. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cement and nails

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is married and has four children aged between two and twelve; three of them are enrolled in schools. She sells cooking oil and biscuits in the shop she has been running for five years. With the loan, she wants to buy more cooking oil and biscuits to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Klara

texts.en:
Klara is a 40-year-old widow who has a son namely Putra, 8 years old, studying at the 3rd grade of elementary school. Klara sells yellow rice at the school canteen near her house. Since the death of her husband, Klara works hard to cover their living costs. She has never given up when dealing with the difficulties. In a day, Klara usually sells up to 35 portions of yellow rice with fried noodles, small fried fish, fried egg and sambal as side dishes. Sometimes Klara changes the menu so the customers will not get bored. 

Klara dreams of improving her business by selling more portions of yellow rice. She has requested loan of IDR 4,000,000 from TLM. The loan would enable Klara to purchase more business stock, i.e., rice, noodles, spices, eggs, plastic spoons, and mica plastic packages.

loans.use: to purchase more business stock, i.e., rice, noodles, spices, eggs, plastic spoons, and mica plastic packages.

loans.name: Hilda Susana

texts.es: Hilda  de 30 años, vive en la ciudad de Cartagena  con su esposo y sus tres hijos en las edades de 3 a 8 años. Su experiencia de negocio la adquirió hace 8 años, vendiendo mercancía variada por encargo, entre vecinos y referidos; con su actividad logró ahorros e hizo un curso de confecciones y posteriormente  incursionó en el mundo de la moda, organizando su  taller en el lugar donde vive. Ella ofrece el servicio de confeccionar uno a uno de acuerdo con el estilo y la moda que sus clientes decidan y  a la medida de cada cual.  Entre sus clientes principales están compañeras de la iglesia, en la cual participa, vecinos y referidos por estas. También vende mercancía especialmente cosméticos, que es la línea que mas rota en su negocio. Sus ventas las realiza a crédito y muchas veces de contado y recupera su dinero semanal, quincenal, mensual, de acuerdo con lo pactado con su cliente. Compra en almacenes especializados de telas e insumos de confecciones y proveedores de cosméticos; con ellos adquiere    precios competitivos, por ser una buena cliente y por sus compras de contado. En la medida en que su negocio crece su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para responder con oportunidad a su clientela, porque trabaja a todo costo y tienen muchos encargos de cosméticos. Su meta es extenderse en el mercado y aumentar su capital de trabajo,  por eso ha recurrido a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará cosméticos, telas e insumos para elaborar ropa infantil y cosméticos para responder a nuevos clientes. Hilda dia a dia se esmera en su trabajo, con el fin de hacer crecer su negocio y lograr su máximo sueño que es el de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Hilda, age 30, lives in the city of Cartagena with her husband and three children, who are between three and eight years old.  She got her business experience eight years ago by selling various merchandise by order to friends and referred customers.

With her business activity she managed to get savings, and she took a sewing course.  She later entered the world of fashion by organizing her workshop in the place where she lives.  She offers individual sewing services according to the style, fashion, and size that her customers select.  Among her main customers are her colleagues at the church she attends, neighbors, and referrals.  

She also sells merchandise, especially cosmetics, which is the line that turns over the most in her business.  She makes her sales on credit, and many times for cash.  She collects her money weekly, biweekly, or monthly, according to the agreement with her customer.

She buys at warehouses specializing in fabrics and sewing supplies and from make-up providers from whom she gets competitive prices for being a good customer and for her cash purchases.  To the extent that her business is growing she does not have enough working capital to respond to her customers in a timely fashion because she works very hard and has a lot of cosmetic orders.

Her goal is to extend herself in the market and to increase her working capital.  To do this she turns to a Kiva loan, her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to buy cosmetics, fabric, and supplies to make children’s clothes.  She will also buy cosmetics in order to respond to new customers.

Hilda puts great effort into her work every day.  She does this to make her business grow and to achieve her biggest dream, which is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, fabric, and supplies to make children’s clothes.  She will also buy cosmetics in order to respond to new customers.

loans.name: Robinson

texts.en:
Robinson is a 41-year-old retail shop proprietor in Kilifi. He is married and has been doing this business for the past three years with great success. 

Robinson is a longtime client at KADET LTD and this marks his third loan with the organization. He plans to purchase more stock of cooking oil, rice, baking flour, maize flour and washing powders for his shop. He will use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and gradually expand his shop.

He hopes to expand his retail shop into a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice, baking flour, maize flour and washing powders

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie works hard to support her family. Merlie is married and has a clothing sales business in the Philippines.

Merlie requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like blouses, pants, and slippers.

Merlie has been in this business for 17 years.

In the future, Merlie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like blouses, pants, and slippers.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina is a woman who likes to work very hard. She has been working in her own workshop from early morning till late evening for two years. She has been busy with sewing of national dresses. She has a lot of clients and all of them are glad about her business. She has not any children because she is a divorcee. She manages with her business alone. 

Zarina wants to develop her business and from the profit to improve her living conditions. She is asking for a loan to buy a new sewing machine for developing the business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah is 36 years old, single and supports three of his family members. He runs a second-hand shoe stall which has been in operation for the last five years, making a monthly income of KES 6000. 


This is his first loan from KADET and he plans to buy more shoes for resale. He hopes to use the anticipated profits to support his business expansion. 


In future he hopes to have better family living standards.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes for resale

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 36 years old. He sells rice and sugar, which he has been doing for five years. 

Joseph is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy rice and sugar to sell. With the profits from his business, he hopes to save money.

loans.use: to purchase rice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Rahmat
loans.use: to provide various products for a kiosk, i.e., sugar, coffee, frying oil, snacks and cigarettes; in addition he would also like to buy 4 more trawls.

loans.name: Isabel Maria

texts.es: Isabel  de 38 años de edad vive en el municipio de Cartagena  con su que cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 3 y 10 años. Ella inicialmente se dedicó a vender mercancía mediante encargos  y con ello pudo adelantar su carrera profesional como educadora preescolar. Una vez finalizó sus estudios y desde hace 3 años, emprendió el sueño de tener un centro educativo dirigido a la primera infancia, como hoy lo ha logrado. En su Jardín infantil privado,  se dedica a la educación de párvulos y preescolar, en el horario de la mañana, sus principales clientes son los padres de familia, quienes confían en los buenos oficios educativos de Isabel y que pagan su mensualidad puntualmente. En la actualidad Isabel ha recibido dos financiamientos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con los cuales les ha ido muy bien, pues ha logrado el mejoramiento de la calidad reflejada en su infraestructura educativa. Hoy planea hacer su primer credikiva con el que comprara una reja para estructurar la recreación segura de los niños que son su principal tesoro. Su meta es lograr separar totalmente su actividad  de el sitio de vivienda, por eso sueña con adquirir su propia casa y lo mejor es estamos seguros de que más adelante lo logrará.
texts.en:
Isabel, age 38, lives in the Cartagena municipality with her husband and two children, ages three and ten.  In the beginning she sold merchandise by order, and by doing so she was able to advance in her professional career as a pre-school teacher. 

Once she finished her studies three years ago, she began her dream of having an educational center dedicated to early childhood, as she now has achieved.  In her private nursery school she devotes herself to pre-school students during the morning schedule.

Her main customers are parents who have confidence in Isabel’s good educational work.  They pay punctually every month.

Isabel has now received two loans from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. They have gone very well for her.  She has managed to improve, which can be seen in the quality of her educational infrastructure.

She now plans her first Kiva loan.  She will use the loan to buy a  fence to make the recreation area safe for the children, who are her foremost treasure.

Her goal is to manage to have her business activity completely separate from the site of her home.  For this dream she needs to get her own house.  The best part is that we are sure that later on she will manage to do so.

loans.use: to buy a  fence to make the recreation area safe for the children.

loans.name: Ambrosio

texts.es: Este es su segundo credikiva y Ambrosio se encuentra muy satisfecho por lo logrado en sus ventas de aceite, arroz, café, azucar,detergentes y en general artículos de aseo personal y refrescos, porque estos artículos los compró en mayor volumen y ganó descuentos. Hoy está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento porque planea continuar aumentando su capital de trabajo, manteniendo surtido su negocio y continuar obteniendo descuentos por sus compras en volumen y de contado le ofrecen mejores utilidades. El envía el siguiente mensaje a sus financiadores de Kiva " Agradezco la ayuda recibida y deseo para ustedes y sus familia mucha prosperidad. "
texts.en:
This is Ambrosio’s second Kiva loan, and he is very happy about what he has achieved in his sales.  He sells cooking oil, rice, coffee, sugar, detergents, general personal care items, and soft drinks.  He bought these items in bulk and got discounts.

He is now applying for a new loan because he plans to continue increasing his work capital, keeping his business stocked, and getting discounts for buying in bulk and for cash, which provides better profits.

He sends the following message to his Kiva lenders, “I am grateful for the help I have received, and I wish you and your family much prosperity.”

loans.use: to buy supplies, soft drinks, and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Ana Bertila

texts.es:
La señora Ana tiene 44 años de edad, esta casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Desde hace 20 años ella se dedica a cultivar maíz y yuca. Ana tiene que caminar a pie varios kilómetros hasta llegar al lugar donde tiene sus cultivos. Durante todo el día realiza labores de limpieza, de fumigación, entre otras más. Su compañero de vida le ayuda a realizar estas actividades, fue con él con quien aprendió ese trabajo y debido a la necesidad de crecer a sus hijos teniendo un empleo digno.  

Ella aborda un autobús en su comunidad en el cual viaja durante treinta minutos hasta llegar a la ciudad, en donde compra los productos que necesita y posteriormente se regresa a su casa.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar 5 sacos de fertilizantes y otros insecticidas para cultivar  7,000 metros cuadrados de yuca y 3,500 metros cuadrados de maíz. Con la inversión ella comprara todos los insumos de una sola vez, para conseguir un precio más bajo, evitando viajar tanto a comprar por poquitos. Al mismo tiempo que aplicara todos los insumos a sus cultivos para obtener una abundante cosecha y mayores ingresos económicos. Uno de los mayores sueños de Ana es que sus hijos se gradúen en la universidad para que sean útiles al país y posean un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana is 44 years old , married and has four children.  She has been growing yucca and corn for 20 years.  Ana has to walk several kilometers to get to her fields.  All day long she works at cleaning, fumigating and doing other work on her crops.  Her life partner helps her with this work and was the one that taught her how to do it.  This is decent work that allows her to provide for her children.

She takes a bus from her community and travels 30 minutes to get to the city where she buys the products that she needs and then returns to her home.

The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of 5 sacks of fertilizer and insecticides for the farming of 7,000 square meters of yucca and 3,500 square meters of corn.  With this investment she will be able to buy all the supplies at once, getting a lower price and will be able to avoid traveling so much.  Also, she can apply all the products to her fields to get a more abundant harvest and get more income.  One of the main dreams that Ana has is for her children to graduate from university so that they can be more useful to the country and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of fertilizer and insecticides to grow 7,000 square meters of yucca and 3,500 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 30 years old and has seven children.

Evangeline works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Evangeline has borrowed and paid back two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and earns additional income from farming vegetables.

Evangeline aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 47 years old and married with three children.

Fe works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Fe has borrowed and paid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 17 years and earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

Fe aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 55 years old and widowed with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Juanita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Juanita has been farming rice for one year and earns additional income from selling rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Shabana's Group

texts.en:
Shabana is 40 years old, married and has a one-year-old daughter. She is a housewife, remaining at her home and taking care of her household tasks.
Her husband is a rickshaw driver and provides transport services to his passengers. He is an expert driver and his passengers trust him very much and like to travel with him.

Shabana has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband who will repair his auto-rickshaw as its engine is creating problems. By repairing his auto-rickshaw, he will be able to provide better transport services for his passengers and increase his income.

Note: In the photo the lady raising her hand is Shabana.

loans.use: To repair auto-rickshaw for rickshaw transport business

loans.name: Eduard

texts.en:
Eduard is a 30-year-old entrepreneur. He is married to Rosalina, 27, and has been blessed with three children: Elviana, 5 years old; Aldorius, 3 and a half years old; and George, 2 and a half years old. After he graduated from Junior high school, Eduard worked at a furniture business, from which he learned the skill to create various types of furniture, i.e.. beds, cabinets, door frames, window sills, tables, chairs, etc. In 2011, Eduard decided to quit his previous employer and start his own business. 

At the moment, he is able to employ one assistant to help him in completing the work. Eduard is really grateful for having many orders from his customers. Recently, he got orders to produce 32 door frames and 32 window sills but he doesn’t have enough wood in stock to complete the order. Therefore, he requested a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 4,500,000 to buy wood.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Shila

texts.en:
Shila is 36 years old, married to Benard, and supports a family of four. She has been a poultry farmer for the last three years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000. 


This is her second loan from KADET after she repaid her previous loan successfully. She plans to buy more chickens for rearing and future resale at a profit. She plans to use the anticipated profits to reinvest in her business. 


Her future dreams are to give quality education to her children.

loans.use: To purchase chickens for rearing and future resale

loans.name: Farhod

texts.en: Farhod is a very successful businessman. For more than four years he has had his own business with driving. He has own mini-bus and drives the local people to go from one place to another. He has a lot of clients and serves them with high quality. That’s why all his clients are glad about his work. He has a lovely wife and three little children. His wife doesn’t work and Farhod must provide his family with all modern conveniences alone. He is asking for a loan to buy a new mini-bus for developing business and to get additional income. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a mini-bus for developing business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 28 years old, single, and has one child. She owns a bakery, a business she started three years ago.  She earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES.

Grace is requesting her first loan for 20,000 KES, which she will use to purchase two bales of baking flour, 10 crates of eggs, and other ingredients.  She plans on using the profit she earns to acquire a more spacious premise. Her hopes are to see her business expand and alleviate poverty in her family.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of baking flour, 10 crates of eggs, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 27 years old, married, and has one child.  He is from Tulkarem.  He owns an aluminum shop where he makes and creates kitchens, windows, and doors.

Mohammad is requesting a youth loan from  Ryada, which he will use to buy an aluminum cutting machine.  He hopes that buying this machine will help him to increase his income.  His ambition is to provide his son with the best education he can afford.

loans.use: to buy an aluminum cutting machine.

loans.name: Waryani

texts.en:
Waryani is 43 years old and has two adult children, both of whom work. Waryani supports her family by running a kiosk business, selling kerosene, sweet ice, ice cubes, etc. She operates the business for 14 hours a day. Once a week, Waryani purchases her kiosk stocks at the market. 

Waryani would be able to produce more income if she could sell more products at her kiosk, such as rice, frying oil, sugar, coffee, syrup, eggs, margarine, wheat flour, etc. Usually, the demand of those products increases towards Idul Fitri celebration. Waryani is requesting a loan from TLM for 4,500,000 IDR, which she will use to purchase those products.  She is hoping that the loan assistance from TLM will enable her to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase kiosk products, such as rice, frying oil, sugar, coffee, syrup, eggs, margarine, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Desiderio

texts.es:
El señor Desiderio tiene 61 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Él tiene una energía y ganas de trabajar muy grandes. Cuenta con 40 años de dedicarse a la agricultura y lo que más cultiva es maíz y yuca. Esta labor la aprendió de sus padres, pues era lo único que sabían hacer. Él nunca asistió a la escuela ya que la primordial era realizar las labores agrícolas y al cuido del ganado. 

Él aborda un autobús en su comunidad en el cual viaja durante treinta minutos hasta llegar a la ciudad, en donde compra los productos que necesita y posteriormente se regresa a su casa.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar 5 sacos de fertilizantes que cuesta $58 cada uno, un galón de gramoxone que cuesta $19, entre otros insumos más para cultivar  7,000 metros cuadrados de yuca y 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. Con la inversión comprara todos los insumos de una sola vez, para conseguir un precio más bajo. 

Permitiéndole obtener una buena cosecha e ingresos para cancelar puntualmente el préstamo. Desiderio pretende seguir trabajando fuertemente para ahorrar y comprar unas dos vacas lecheras, a fin de obtener otros ingresos y la alimentación de su familia.
texts.en:
Desiderio is 61 years old. He is married and has two children. He is full of energy and eagerness to work. He has forty years of farming experience and he grows mostly corn and yuca. He learned the trade from his parents, since that was all they knew how to do. He never went to school, because farming and tending to the livestock were the priority.

He boards a bus in his community and travels thirty minutes until he arrives at the city, where he purchases the products he needs, and later goes back home. The loan he is requesting is to purchase five sacks of fertilizer, which cost $58 each, a gallon of gramoxone, which costs $19, and other supplies for farming 1.7 acres of yuca and 1.7 acres of corn. He will use the investment to purchase all the supplies at once, so that he can get a lower price. This will allow him to obtain a good harvest and enough income so that he can pay off his loan on time.

Desiderio intends to keep working hard so that he can save up and purchase two milk cows, in order to obtain extra income and feed his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, gramoxone, and other supplies to grow yuca and corn.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lucia works hard to support her family.

She has a livestock business in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming vegetables. Lucia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell for her livestock business.

Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Milly
