Monica is the secretary of the communal bank group.  In the picture she is seated in the second row, second from the right, in blue jeans and a light green jacket with a black bag in her lap.  Her hair is dark brown and long.  She has been selling shower curtains, cushions, covers, clothing and women's articles such as purses, bags, and billfolds for a year.  She says her work schedule depends on her availability.

She usually buys her merchandise in the city of Santiago from the dealers and stores that specialize in the sale of fabrics and other articles.  She will use the loan to buy fabric for her sewing jobs and women's clothing in different styles and sizes.  Her goal is to open a minimarket in a location to generate more income, so she can have a better lifestyle and give her family the best she can.

Monica lives with her husband, granddaughter and three daughters, ages 22, 17 and 15.  Her family goal is to have her own house and for her daughters to finish their education to become successful professionals; and on a work level, to have an established business.  She is very grateful and happy about the opportunity received through Fondo Esperanza, which will allow her to invest in her business.  She says the training has been fundamental in her business and for her personal development, since she has learned how to organize and distribute her income and investments better.  In her communal bank she feels very comfortable because the members are united and responsible.

Valparaíso is located 120 kilometers northwest of Santiago.  It is the regional capital as well as the country's seat of legislative power.  It is the number one port of the nation and offers a wide variety of beautiful, picturesque sites, such as the home of the poet Pablo Neruda, winner of the Nobel Prize.

loans.use: To buy fabric to make different sizes and styles of women's clothing.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 51 years old and lives in Nakuru. She is married and has three children who are all in school.

Jane has a retail shop that she has been running for the past four years. She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD, to enable her to buy soft drinks, cooking oil, soaps, etc. to add to her shop's inventory.

She hopes to buy a plot of land in the near future and be able to build a house.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, cooking oil, and soaps

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more provisions for resale

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 33 years old and has a tailoring shop in Nyahururu town. She is a single mother of two children.

This will be her first loan, which she plans to use to buy an overlock sewing machine, more material for sewing, and sewing threads. With the anticipated profits she plans to buy more tailoring materials.

In the future, Esther hopes to grow her business, make more income, and be able to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and tailoring materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice and beans.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua sells foodstuffs in Adum Banso, near Takoradi. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. 

Ekua has been selling foodstuffs for 12 years now. She is responsible for paying her children’s school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more food in bulk. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more food in bulk.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 40 years old and married. He is blessed with six children, ages 3 through 13. He is a small-scale farmer in the Kabarnet municipality. This has been his source of income for the last two years. From this business, he earns an average income of KES 20,000 a month.
 
Michael is borrowing his fifth loan of KES 90,000 from KADET LTD, after successfully paying his previous loans. With this loan, he intends to buy farm inputs, i.e. maize, beans, seeds and fertilizers, as well as start poultry farming. 

He intends to use the anticipated profits to invest back into the business as well as pay the school fees for his children. His future plans are to be financially stable, expand his business and give his children the best education possible.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and start poultry farming.

loans.name: Lidia Margarita

texts.es: La Sra. Lidia de estado Civil Casada, su esposo es quien participa de la presente solicitud de crédito, tiene 3 hijos de 22, 20 y 18 años de edad a quienes apoya moral y económicamente, hace mas de 10 años que se dedica a la Agricultura y Ganadería, por ello solicita el crédito para la compra de una Vaca Lechera, pues con esto podrá elevar un poco mas sus ingresos y darles a sus hijos una mejor vida, pues su esposo tiene como actividad el Transporte Publico pero como su vehículo esta a Gasolina no tiene mucha Ganancia Liquida para ellos. Desde muy pequeña la cliente trabajo en lo que es trabajos de Campo junto a sus padres a quienes siguen apoyándolos en lo que respecta en al siembra y cosecha de la misma, es de condición humilde y valora lo que tiene, pues gracias a su esfuerzo y voluntad de ella y su esposo salieron adelante y pudieron hacerse su casita donde viven actualmente.
texts.en: Lidia is married, and her husband is the one participating in the current loan request. She has 3 children, aged 22, 20 and 18, for whom she provides both moral and economic support. For more than 10 years, she has worked in agriculture and ranching. For this reason she is requesting the loan to buy a milk cow, because with this she will be able to increase her income a little more and give her children a better life. Her husband's work is public transportation, but since his vehicle runs on gasoline, he doesn't have much net profit for his family. Since she was very young, the borrower worked in farming together with her parents, whom she continues to help with the planting and harvest of their crops. She is from a humble background and values what she has, since thanks to the effort and determination of herself and her husband, they have been able to get ahead and were able to build the little house where they currently live.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kacwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past two years, Agnes has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells general goods. 

To help expand her business, Agnes has requested a loan of 700,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more goods such as sugar, soap, rice and beans for her store. This will help Agnes to generate greater profits and pay for her medical expenses. Agnes hopes that in the future she will be able to educate her child. 

Agnes is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Agnes' future prospects by helping her save money.

loans.use: to purchase more goods such as sugar, soap, rice and beans for her store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 42-year-old woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 5 years to 20 years. She describes herself to be a kind and loyal woman. She operates a retail store where she sells clothes for resale. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located within a busy area and her primary customers are local residents. 

Mary describes her biggest business challenge to be difficulty with communication barriers with the customers due to different languages. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase one bale of clothes for resale. Her business goal is to diversify her business into a boutique  within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will  have improved  her business.

loans.use: to buy one bale of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann has a grocery store in Nyahururu town and has been running the business for the past three years. She is 38 years old, married to Joseph, and they have five children.

This will be her first loan and she plans to buy bananas and more cereals for sale in her business. With the anticipated profits, she plans to pay school fees for her children.

In the future, Ann hopes to grow her business, make more income, and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy bananas and cereals.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is 42 years old. He is married to Loise and together they have three children. He is a farmer and has been in the business for the past 10 years.

This is his second term loan with KADET LTD. He paid his previous loans well and in good time. He will use the loan amount to purchase seedlings and fertilizer and to pay laborers on his farm.

He hopes to become among the top leading farmers in his area.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Monique

texts.fr: Monique est une femme de 52 ans divorcé, mère de 5 enfants dont l'age varie entre 14 et 25 ans. Trois de ses enfants vont encore à l'école. Elle est commerçante et vend du bois de chauffage depuis 20ans, c''est grâce à cette activité qu'elle subvient aux besoins de sa famille. La bonne maitrise et son expérience dans cette activité agrandit sa clientèle au fil du temps. Elle s’approvisionne sauvant dans les villages en achetants des tas de bois pour fendre et detailler. Mais elle aimerai grace à ce crédit pouvoir remplir un pick up de bois parce que celà lui rapportera plus de bénéfice.Elle épargnera une partie de son profit et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Monique is 52 years old. She is divorced and the mother of 5 children aged between 14 and 25. Three of her children still attend school. Monique is a retailer and has been selling firewood for 20 years; it is thanks to her business that she is able to meet her family's needs. Her good knowledge and experience in her area of work have helped her grow her customer base over the years. She often gets her supplies in the villages, buying stacks of wood which she splits and sells retail.

Monique would like, thanks to this loan, to be able to buy a pickup load of wood because that would generate more profit for her. She will save a part of her profit and the rest of it will enable her to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy wood wholesale.

loans.name: Bidossessi Group

texts.fr: BIDOSSESSI est un groupe de neuf personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Angèle Denise (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 59 ans. Angèle Denise a peu fréquenté l’école. Angèle Denise est une veuve et mère de six enfants, tous scolarisés, dont aucun ne reste à sa charge. Angèle Denise vit seule et assure seule ses charges. Depuis dix sept ans, Angèle Denise mène comme activité la vente des boissons à son domicile. Angèle Denise s’approvisionne dans un dépôt du Bénin. Afin d’élever le niveau de leur activité, Angèle Denise sollicite un troisième crédit ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe BIDOSSESSI. Ce crédit leur permettra de renforcer leurs activités et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Bidossessi is a group of 9 people whose members live in the same district. The group's representative, Angèle Denise (whose hand is raised in the picture), is 59 years old. She did not get much schooling. She is a widow and mother of 6 children, all of whom are educated and independent. Angèle Denise lives alone and takes care of her own needs; she has been selling drinks from her home for 17 years. She gets her supplies from a depot in Benin.

In order to raise their level of business activity, Angèle Denise and the other members of the Bidossessi group are requesting a 3rd loan from ALIDé together. This loan will enable them to strengthen their business activities and to better respond to customer demand. The first 2 loans have been properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy drinks.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
Rosalía tiene 57 años, es viuda. Vive con su hija, de 30 años, y dos nietos.
Se dedica a la agricultura desde que era muy joven, toda su vida ha estado rodeada del campo y sembríos, por eso tiene una actitud de fortaleza. A su edad no se hace problemas para coger las herramientas de trabajo y producir tubérculos, como papas de distintas variedades, además de avena, cebada, habas y alfalfa, en menores cantidades. Cuando llega la cosecha ya sabe cómo negociar sus productos; con la ayuda de su hija traslada sus productos hacia las ciudades de Lima (capital del país) y Chanchamayo (selva central). Rosalía es una mujer que no se cansa fácilmente, pues a la vez se encarga de atender a sus animales (ovejas y cuyes), a los que cría y luego vende. Ahora se encuentra en la cosecha de habas y luego iniciará una siembra de papas, para lo que necesita una gran inversión.

Este es su crédito número 12 con MFP, por lo que agradece tanta confianza depositada en ella durante todos estos años de acceder a los préstamos. Pertenece al banco comunal “La Libertad de Huaricolca”.
Esta vez, con este dinero comprará bolsas de fertilizantes para enriquecer sus tierras después de haber cosechado las habas.
texts.en:
Rosalía, 57, is a widow and lives with her 30-year-old daughter and two grandchildren.

She has been involved in agriculture since she was very young, and all her life has been surrounded by countryside and sown fields, which have given her an attitude of strength.  At her age, she has no problem picking up work tools to produce tubers, such as potatoes in different varieties, and oats, barley, beans and alfalfa, in smaller quantities.  At harvest time she knows how to negotiate shen selling her produce.  With her daughter's help she takes her produce to the cities of Lima (capital) and Chanchamayo (central forest).  Rosalía is a woman who does not tire easily, as she is always caring for her animals (sheep and guinea pigs), which she later sells.  Now it is bean harvest time, and afterwards she will begin sowing potatoes for which she must make a large investment.

This is her 12th loan through MFP, and she is grateful for the confidence shown in her over the years.  She belongs to the communal bank "La Libertad de Huaricolca".

This time, the money will be used to buy bags of fertilizers to enrich the soil after harvesting the beans.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her cropland.

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en:
Immaculate is married with four children, three of whom go to school. She has had a retail shop business for five years. 

Immaculate has applied for a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, boxes of soap and small cans of cooking oil. She rents a shop that acts like a business premise and works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include transportation and thieves. 

Immaculate aspires to own a fully stocked retail shop and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house with electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, boxes of soap and small cans of cooking oil.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 48 years old and married. He and his wife, Esther, have four school-going children. He has practiced farming for the last 15 years. 
 
Benson is a farmer and has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy fertilizers and farm inputs to use on his farm.

In the future, he hopes to become a leading farmer in his area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is aged  31, single, and has one child. She has been in farming for two consecutive years and reiterates that farming has been her source of income for the past two years and remains optimistic her family's living standard will continue to improve so long as she remains an active farmer. Her farm currently produces vegetables, milk, maize and beans which she sells within the local market.

Priscilla has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She wants to improve her dairy farming business since it has better prospects and will use the income to give better education to her child.

Priscilla however mentions animal diseases and unpredictable weather conditions as the challenge and mainly also dairy feed.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 32 years old. She is married to Gerishon and together they have two children. She operates a retail shop and has been in the business for the past four years.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She was introduced by a field officer. She will use the loan amount to purchase stock of sugar, rice and flour for stock in her business for sale.

She hopes to open a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar,rice and flour for sale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is married with seven children, and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

She has a business selling fish and has been in this business for four years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more baskets of fish. 

Besides this fish business, she generates additional income through selling and frying chapatti and samosas. She works seven days a week and works from her home selling to all categories of people.  

Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality.  She is aspiring to see her business grow big so that she becomes a wholesaler and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity, but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses  includes school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more baskets of fish

loans.name: Jay-To Group

texts.en:
Jay-to is a group of two women who are traders. They sell slippers and soft drinks: Coca-Cola, Fanta, Sprite and Malta Guiness. Janet and Emelia come from Nungua in Accra. 

Janet operates a drinking bar at her home, whereas Emelia, the slippers seller, hawks between Teshie and Nungua. Emelia is 49 years old and single, with two children.  Janet is 44 years old and married, with two children.  Both have been selling these products for 12 years now. 

This is their third loan cycle with ID-Ghana. They have repaid previous loans successfully, and they need 1,400 Ghana cedis to be able to expand their businesses. They will pay back this loan in full.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude is 35 years old, married with six children aged between 2 and 12, and he takes care of eight relatives. He sells various goods such as: biscuits, toilet paper, juice, books, plastic shoes, etc. He has eleven years of experience in this work and he currently employs two people to help him. 

Jean Claude has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various goods such as: biscuits, toilet paper, juice, books, plastic shoes, etc. for resale. With any profits, he will be able to save money for his future and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy various goods such as: biscuits, toilet paper, juice, books, plastic shoes, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is a petty trader at Dabur near Elmina.  She is married and her husband is a farmer.  She is responsible for paying the accommodation and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy maize so that she can start making 'kenkey', which is cooked and fermented maize and cassava dough, often served with fish or tomato sauce. She hopes to use the new profits to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy maize

loans.name: Mena

texts.en: Mena sells 'kenkey' (cooked and fermented maize dough) at Dabur near Elmina. Mena has received no formal education.  She is married and has seven children. Her husband is a farmer. Mena has been selling 'kenkey' for 10 years. She is responsible for paying her children's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy maize. She hopes to use the new profits to continue to expand her business and take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy maize

loans.name: Mena

texts.en: Mena sells bread and other provisions such as milk and soft drinks at Dabur near Elmina. She is divorced. Mena has had her business for two years. Her loan will be used to buy bread and other items to stock her inventory. She hopes to use the new profits to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bread and other items

loans.name: Anjelina

texts.en:
Anjelina is 51 years old and has been in farming for ten years in her rural home area in Kitale, Western Kenya where she lives with her family- her husband and one child aged 18 years. She runs her farm with the help of three farmhands and produces eggs, milk, and sugarcane. She also sells molasses to local dairy farmers.

Anjelina has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow. She says this will improve her income and provide enough milk for the family while also meeting other family basic needs. She reiterates Juhudi Kilimo loans have really empowered her since she got the first loan of 30,000 KES which helped her establish poultry farming. She remains optimistic that the dairy business too will improve her family income significantly.

She, however, points out animal diseases are an inherent problem.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy tiene 23 años, su pareja es Edner, con quien tiene dos hijos: Wilian y Franco. Juntos viven en la casa que levantaron en un terreno heredado y se ubicada en el caserío de Casacoto.
Ya son con 7 años que Nancy se dedica a la agricultura en terrenos propios y arrendados. Produce arveja, papa y habas; “mis chacras están bien lejos, a casi 40 minutos subiendo las lomas”, menciona. Inició vendiendo sus productos en la ciudad más cercana, pero con el tiempo se dio cuenta que las ventas eran mejores en la ciudad de Lima. Desde entonces viaja con frecuencia llevando sus productos para allá. Este mes se inicia la siembra de papas en grandes cantidades; no dejará pasar este momento, por eso invertirá en fertilizantes y semillas. “El trabajo será intenso pero gratificante”, dice.

Este es el cuarto crédito que tiene con MFP, entidad a la que agradece por las charlas educativas y la oportunidad de crecer dentro de su banco comunal “Sembradoras de Casacotos”.
Nancy invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de semillas de papas de los tipos “única” y “yungay”, también comprará bolsas de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Nancy, 23, and her husband, Edner, have two sons, Willian and Franco.  They live in the house they built on inherited land in the rural community of Casacoto.

For seven years Nancy has been farming her own property and rented land.  She grows peas, potates and beans.  "My land is quite far, about a 40-minute walk up the hills", she says.  She started selling her produce in nearby cities, but over time realized that sales were better in the city of Lima.  Since then she travels frequently to take her produce there.  This month she will begin sowing potatoes in large quantities, and as she does not want to waste time, she plans to buy fertilizers and seeds.  "The work is intense but gratifying", she states.

This is her fourth loan through MFP, where she is thankful to have had educational seminars and the opportunity to grow in her communal bank "Sembradoras de Casacotos".

Nancy will use the loan to buy potato seeds of the "única" and "yungay" varieites, as well as bags of fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds and bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Mandzano Group

texts.en:
Manadzano is a group of two women who sell rice, fish, yams, and plastic products (ice chests, plastic bowls). Dora is 40 years old and single; Rebecca is 62 years old and also single. They live in the same neighbourhood, called  "antehwe" Teshie.

Dora is a plastic-products seller with 14 years' trading experience. She is in her fourth loan cycle with initiative development-Ghana.  She repaid her previous loans successfully. She buys her products from the Accra market and sells them at Ashaiman. Her profit margin is 100 GHS per month. She need this loan to buy more stock to expand her business.

They need 1,100 GHS to be able to expand their offerings.

loans.use: To buy more plastic products to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow and buy poultry birds

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty  is married to a mechanic and they have two children. One of her children goes to school and the other one is still young.  She takes care of her old mother. She has a beauty salon and has been in this business for five years.  She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids.  

Betty generates additional income through rental rooms. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring of owning a fully stocked beauty salon and building more rental rooms.  She works six days a week and works from a rented shop.  She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly   rent for her business and school fees are her major expenses.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a resident and a farmer in Nkubu area of Central Kenya and has five years of experience in active mixed farming with her farm currently producing maize, beans and bananas. She is married with two children aged 9 and 2 years.

Betty has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her set up fish farming. She will use part of the loan to buy a lining material for the pond as well as buy fingerlings and initial food for them. She is enthusiastic that the business will have high returns due to availability of ready markets for fish within the local markets.

Betty is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for making farming loans available to smallholder farmers.

loans.use: To buy fish pond lining and fingerlings

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a resident and a farmer in Nkubu area of Central Kenya. She is aged 52 and married with three adult children. She has been in active farming for over thirty years and produces tea, coffee, bananas and milk for the local market.

Violet has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her buy dairy feed and construct a zero grazing units for her growing number of dairy cows. She says dairy farming has been registering very good returns but the challenge remains the high costs of feed and more specifically during dry seasons, with adverse effect on income volumes. She remains optimistic the zero grazing units will help mitigate the challenge.

She appreciates Juhudi Kilimo’s efficiency with loan processing.

loans.use: To buy dairy feed and construct a zero grazing unit

loans.name: Gisele

texts.fr: Gisele est une jeune femme de 34 ans,mariée et mère de 02 enfants dont l'age varie entre 2 à 5ans.Un de ses enfants va déjà à l'école.Elle gère un petit centre d'appels téléphonique(call box) dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 5 ans et tient également une petite échoppe dans laquelle elle vend du savon,du cube,du sucre,du sel et bien d'autres.Elle s'approvisionne en crédit de communication auprès des opérateurs téléphoniques en moyenne 02 fois par semaine.Mais cependant,la demande de crédit et d'appel étant de plus en plus croissante,elle a du mal a satisfaire sa clientèle car son capital ne lui permet pas de s'approvisionner convenablement ce qui cause de constantes ruptures de stock et la perte progressive de sa clientèle.Elle sollicite dont ce crédit afin de s'approvisionner plus en crédit de communication ce qui lui permettra de retenir et accroître sa clientèle et par conséquent ses bénéfices.Bénéfices qui lui permettra de réinvestir dans sa petite échoppe afin de l'agrandir,mais également de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Gisele is 34 years old. She is married and the mother of 2 children aged 2 and 5. One of her children is already going to school. Gisele has been running a small "call box" business in a district of the capital for 5 years, and also owns a small stall from which she sells soap, stock cubes, sugar, salt and many other items. She buys calling credit from the telecom operators twice a week, on average. However, the demand for calls and credit is steadily increasing, and she is having problems fulfilling her customers' demands as her capital does not allow her to restock properly, which produces constant inventory problems and is causing her the gradual loss of her customers.

Gisele is requesting this loan so that she can get more calling credit which will enable her to retain and grow her customer base and, consequently, her profits. These profits will allow her to reinvest in her small stall in order to grow the business, and also to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy calling credit.

loans.name: Ada

texts.es:
Ada tiene 27 años, su pareja es Edwin, con quien tiene dos hijos; Daniela de 4 años y Dayro de 8 meses. Ellos viven en la casa que su pareja heredó y se ubica en el caserío de Casacoto, Tarma.
Hace 5 años que se dedica a la agricultura. Actividad con la que mantiene a su familia y con la que avizora un mejor futuro. Su especialidad es la producción de papa, de las variedades: “Canchán”, “Tomasa” y otras. Así también siembra otros productos como arvejas, habas, maíz, etc.; los cuales lleva a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad. Pero cuando su producción es mayor, la lleva hasta Lima (capital). “En Lima no se pierde, todos saben que las papas de Tarma son buenas”, menciona. Gracias al apoyo de su pareja trabaja sus cultivos con ahínco y sacrificio, ya que muchas veces las lluvias y el intenso frío tratan de impedir su labor. Ahora es la temporada de siembra grande, por ello invertirá en la compra de semilla de papa.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por ello se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Además, pertenece al banco comunal “Sembradoras de Casacoto”, donde se siente contenta de tener socias amigables.
Ada invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de bolsas de abono (de 120 soles cada una) y guano de corral. También comprará 20 sacos de semilla de papa.
texts.en:
Ada, 27, and her husband, Edwin, have two children: Daniela, four, and Dayro, eight months.  They live in the house her husband inherited in the rural community of Casacoto, Tarma.

For five years she has earned a living in agriculture and supported her family, for which she wants a better future.  Her specialty crop is the potato in the varieties of "Chanchán", "Tomasa" and others.  She also grows peas, beans, corn, etc., which she sells to the wholesale market in the city.  But when she has a large production, she takes it to Lima (capital).  "In Lima one does not lose money because everyone knows the Tarma potatoes are good", she says.  Thanks to the support of her husband, she can dedicate much work and sacrifice to her crops, since many times the rain and intense cold can get in her way.  It is now the important sowing season and she will invest in potato seeds.

This is her third loan through MFP and she is committed to paying it back on time.  Also, she belongs to the communal bank "Sembradoras de Casacoto", which she enjoys because the members are friendly.

Ada will use the loan to buy bags of organic fertilizer (120 PEN each), and 20 sacks of potato seeds.

loans.use: To buy bags of organic fertilizer and potato seeds.

loans.name: Jaime Alejandro

texts.es: El joven Jaime tiene 19 años el es soltero y se dedica a la venta de cosméticos ofreciendo estos productos a todo tipo de personas están entre sus clientes estudiantes universitarios y personal administrativo de la misma universidad, también vende sus productos a instituciones del sector publico donde vende la mayor cantidad de su mercadería y a mejores precios asi mismo los fines de semana el vende en las cercanías de mercados locales como la Huisutes y en la 16 de Julio en el Alto el nos cuenta que los comerciantes con mayor mercadería no le dejan vender sus productos y es víctima de maltrato en algunas ocasiones, de esta forma vende casi de escondidas en estos mercados grandes, el realiza esta actividad desde hace un año atrás para poder pagar los estudios que comienza en la Universidad Estatal este año, realiza esta actividad soñando con el dia en que pueda llegar a finalizar sus estudios y ser un profesional de bien el nos cuenta que se levanta temprano para poder llegar a la universidad pública, la cual se encuentra lejos de su casa pero a el le motiva las ganas que tiene de superar su situación actual y mejorar de esta forma su calidad de vida y la de sus familiares.
texts.en:
Jaime is a 19 year old young bachelor. He sells cosmetics, offering products to all kinds of people. Among his customers are students and administrative personnel at the university. He also sells to institutions in the public sector, where he sells the majority of his merchandise and at better prices. In addition, he sells his products on weekends at surrounding local markets, such as La Huisutes, and on July 16 in El Alto. He tells us that the major merchants try to prevent him from selling his products and he is a victim of abuse on some occasions.  Consequently at the large markets he manages to sell behind their backs. 

Jaime started his business a year ago in order to pay for the studies he is starting this year at the State University. He carries out his sales, dreaming of the day when he will finish his studies and become a good professional. He tells us that he gets up early in order to arrive at the university, which is far from his house. He is motivated by his desire to overcome his current situation and improve his and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to sell cosmetics.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es: El  señor Felipe es una persona muy trabajadora de 34 años de edad, es de estado civil soltero, cuenta con un hijo bajo su dependencia al cual le tiene que pagar  gastos de alimentación, escuela y otros, pero, actualmente se encuentra en una mala situación económica por que no cuenta con suficiente dinero para hacer arreglar  su vehículo  que es la herramienta principal de su trabajo, éste vehículo se encuentra  en mal estado mecánico debido a que sufrió un accidente, es por esta razón que el solicitante necesita arreglar su auto para seguir trabajando y si seguir teniendo la esperanza de que se le otorgue un crédito, para poder continuar trabajando una vez arreglada la movilidad.
texts.en: Mr. Felipe is a hard working 34 year old, is single and has one son that is his dependent, and he pays for his son's food, school and other expenses. However, in this moment he finds himself in a difficult economic situation because he does not have enough money to fix his car, which is his primary source of income. He was in an accident and now the car is in a poor mechanic state and it is because of this that he needs to repair his car, so he can continue to work. He has hope that he will get a loan so he can continue to work once his car is repaired.

loans.use: repair his car (his primary source of income)

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 34 years old and married, with three children, aged between 4 and 7 years old. He has been in farming for ten successive years in his rural home in Kitale.  Some of his farm produce, like onions, vegetables, maize, and beans, goes to the local market.

Geoffrey has made a loan request of KES 41,600 from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow.  He says the additional income from the dairy business will help him meet his family's basic needs.  Most importantly, it will improve his business and enable him to provide a better education for his children when they come of age.

Geoffrey says that the poor roads in the area and bad weather conditions are the usual challenges, but he is coping with them.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Plan De Lucha 1 Group

texts.en:
Ramona is one of the members of the Plan de Lucha (Battle Plan) Group 1, located in the city of Hato Mayor, a primarily agricultural region. It is one of the most rural cities in the Dominican Republic. Her business is a "Fantasia" (a little store specializing in women's products). Ramona is the mother of three children, who live with her and her long-term partner. She tells us that her biggest challenge is to thrive, to have a successful business and a stable life.

Ramona is very excited to receive her tenth loan through Esperanza Internacional, after having successfully repaid her previous loan. This was a step toward making her business grow. She has had her business for about seven years. She started it with her first loan in Esperanza, selling miscellaneous products by walking.

Ramona plans to invest this new loan by purchasing cosmetics, clothing, shoes, jewelry and other products; she is planning to increase her inventory into more quantity and in school supplies. She plans to use her earnings to invest in her house. Her dream is to build her house. She thanks all of you for your support!!!

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, clothing, shoes, jewelry, etc

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a farmer in Nkubu area of Central Kenya and has been in active farming for eleven years. She is married with two children aged 12 and 6 years and both schooling. Her farm products are currently maize, beans and vegetables which she sells to the local market to meet her family's basic needs.

Jane has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds and construct a housing unit for the birds. She says her focus is to grow the poultry business due to good prospects it has compared to other farming production which heavily relies on adequate rains and calls for costly inputs.

She notes there is a major challenge mainly due to bad weather, undeveloped local markets and lack of enough inputs. She however remains optimistic with the farming business.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds and build a poultry housing unit

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a farmer in Kitale with 23 years of experience in mixed farming with her major produce being maize, beans and other horticultural products. She also runs a timber hardware business and low cost rental houses in the local market. She is married with three children aged between 22 and 16 years.

Ruth has made a request for a loan of 60,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds. Her focus is to grow the poultry business in order to earn more income and then venture into dairy farming. She reiterates that her major focus is to boost her capital base so as to do things in a more commercialized way.

She remains grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for loan services.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds and construct poultry housing unit

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a mother of three children and has been in active farming for four years.  She currently runs her farm with the help of one farmhand and produces maize, beans, and horticultural products. She also runs a grocery retail business.

Ruth has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds. She hopes to acquire more land in the next five years for major expansion of her farming business and to boost her family farming income.

Ruth says her main challenges have been rampant fluctuation in market prices and the high cost of inputs.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba sells food stuffs such as kenkey (cooked then fermented maize and cassava dough) at Dabur near Elmina, which she has done for three years. She is divorced and has two children. Aba is responsible for feeding and clothing her children, as well as for paying their school fees. Her loan will be used to buy maize and more of the other goods she sells. She hopes to use the new profits to continue to expand her business and take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy maize and other food stuffs

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama sells palm and kernel oil at Dabur near Elmina, which she has done for three years. She is a widow and has five children. Ama uses her income to feed and clothe her children, as well as to pay for their school fees. Ama will use the loan to purchase more palm nut to process. With the new profits, Ama plans to continue to expand her business and take care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more palm and kernel oil

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa sells cassava  at Dabur near Elmina. She is divorced and has six children. Adjoa has been selling cassava for 20 years. She is responsible for feeding and clothing her children, as well as for paying their school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more cassava. She hopes to use the new profits to continue to expand her business and take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy cassava

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama sells food stuffs at Dabur near Elmina, which she has done for three years. She has received schooling through class three (the third level of primary school).  She is married and has five children. Her husband is a farmer. Ama is responsible for paying for her children’s school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more of the goods she sells like maize. She hopes to use the new profits to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy maize and other food stuffs

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is divorced and has five children.  She sells kenkey (cooked then fermented maize and cassava dough) at Dabur near Elmina, which she has been doing for 16 years. She is responsible for feeding and clothing her children as well as paying their school fees.  She has no formal education.

Esi is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy cassava dough and maize for her kenkey. With the profits, Esi will continue to expand her business and take care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase cassava dough and maize.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua owns a chop bar (a stall or restaurant where a variety of African dishes are sold) at Dabur near Elmina. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a carpenter. Efua uses her income to pay for her children’s school fees. She will use the loan to purchase more ingredients for the food she prepares. With the new profits, Efua plans to to continue to expand her business and take care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for the food she prepares

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina tiene 53 años, tiene dos hijos; Nataly y Ángel, con los que vive en su casa propia ubicada en la zona rural de Huaricolca.
Ella se dedica a la crianza de animales y a la agricultura. Actualmente posee cuatro toros, seis vacas y como sesenta ovejas. Por la cantidad de ganado que tiene siembra pastos para alimentarlos, pero también requieren otro tipo de alimento balanceado, por eso recurre a mezclar los pastos con avena y otros productos naturales. Y como si fuera poco, también se dedica a la siembra de papa en todas sus variedades, pero esta actividad solo lo realiza una vez al año. Mientras cuida de sus terrenos, pasta sus animales y tampoco se hace problemas para preparar los alimentos para los jornaleros que contrata para trabajar la tierra, lo tiene todo planeado. Sabina empieza la siembra en los meses de julio o agosto (temporada de siembras grandes) por eso, esta vez, no dudará y volverá a cultivar papas. 

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza - Huaricolca” y este es su crédito número 6 con MFP. En todo el tiempo que lleva como socia se siente contenta de realizar un buen trabajo al lado de compañeros de grupo.
Sabina invertirá este dinero en dos sacos (de 50 kilos cada uno) de semillas de papa de la variedad “única”. Con lo sobrante comprará guano de corral e isla.
texts.en:
Sabina is 53 years old and has two children: Nataly and Angel, who live with her in her own house located in the rural district of Huaricolca. 

She works raising animals and also in agriculture. She currently has four bulls, six cows and sixty sheep.  For the quantity of cattle she has, she needs to plant grass in fields in order to feed them, but they also require a balanced diet, and so she needs to mix the grass with oats and other natural products. And as if this weren't enough, she also plants all kinds of varieties of potatoes, but she only does this once a year. While she cares for her land, grazes the animals, she also finds time to prepare food for the day workers that she hires to work the land. She has everything planned. Sabina starts to plant in July and August (a season with large planting) and because of this, this time, she has no doubts and will return to cultivating potatoes.

She belongs to the communal bank "Nueva Esperanza-Huaricolca" and this is her sixth loan with MFP. In all the time she has been a member she has been happy to do a good job alongside the other members of the group.

Sabina will invest the money in two sacks (50 kilos each) of potatoes seeds of the variety called "única." With the rest, she will purchase guano .

loans.use: purchase potato seeds and guano for the season.

loans.name: David

texts.es: El Sr. David tiene 42 años tiene dos hijos de las edades de  10 y 5 años, el se dedica a la  reparación de motores en su taller de mecánica que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Alto Olivo,  este préstamo es su tercera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. David va a usar este préstamo para la compra de herramientas de trabajo para su taller de mecánica,   su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo para la compra de herramientas y para la ampliación del negocio, el Sr David enfrenta retos en su negocio que son sacar adelante el negocio y va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir mejorando su taller de mecánica comprando ya herramientas y equipos modernos.
texts.en: David is 42 years old and has two children, who are ten and five years old. He works repairing engines at his auto repair shop located in the area of Alto Olivo. This is his third loan cycle with this institution. David will use this loan to purchase work tools for his auto repair shop. The reason he is requesting this loan is that he lacks the cash to purchase tools and expand his business. In his work, David faces the challenges of keeping the business going, but he is going to use the profits to continue improving his auto repair shop, by purchasing modern tools and equipment.

loans.use: to purchase work tools for his auto repair shop.

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes 1, 5 & 6 Group

texts.en:
Manesa is a member of the “Mujeres Valientes” (Brave Women) 1, 5 & 6 loan group. She is the mother of three children who live with her and her long-term partner in a slum north of Santo Domingo. 

Manesa is very excited to receive her sixth loan from Esperanza Internacional. She has had her business for about 12 years, having started it after arriving in the Dominican Republic and seeing the need to begin working. She used a little bit of capital to go into the business of selling food. Manesa is planning to use her new loan to buy foods such as rice, beans, sugar, vegetables, cooking oil and meats, as well as to buy used clothing. She will use her earnings to invest in her business so that she can improve sales and save enough money to finish building her house. She also wishes to have good health and a life that is more economically stable. She tells us that her most difficult challenge has been to devote herself as a mother to give her children a better future.

loans.use: to buy food to sell to her customers and used clothes.

loans.name: Abenawa

texts.en: Abenawa is divorced and has two children. She sells smoked fish at Dabur near Elmina, which she has done for 20 years. Abenawa uses her income to feed and clothe her children, as well as to pay for their school fees. Abenawa will use the loan to purchase more fish. With the new profits, Abenawa plans to continue to expand her business and take care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fish

loans.name: La Buena Nueva 4 Group

texts.en:
Gloria is one of the members of the Grupo La Buena Nueva (The Good New) 4, located in the city of Samana. This group is composed of five micro-entrepreneurs who sell clothes, shoes, cosmetics, and fruits, and who also provide services including a beauty salon, etc.

Gloria is a businesswoman who lives with her husband and their three children. She tells us that her greatest challenge is to help her children to grow and become professional. She is very excited to receive her 13th loan with Kiva partner Esperanza Internacional, after having satisfactorily paid off her earlier loans, and with each one contributing to growing her business. She has had her business for about seven years. She started it with the aim of making money and being useful and that is when she took her first Esperanza loan. She is planning to use this loan to purchase pounds of chicken to sell in her butcher shop. She plans to use her earnings to help her husband with extra income and provide for any needs, specially for school. Her dream is to have a successful business and a comfortable house.

loans.use: To buy chicken

loans.name: La Confianza 3 Group

texts.en:
Yolanda is the coordinator of the “La confianza” (Trust) Group 3. She is the mother of five children, who live with her and her husband in one of the slum neighborhoods located in the north of Santo Domingo.

Yolanda is very excited to receive her 7th loan with Esperanza International. She has had her business for around six years.  She started it with some savings she had. She used a little bit of capital to buy miscellaneous products and started selling from her house and by walking around. After some years doing business, she needs to invest more capital in her business and she attended the Esperanza International program in her community. 

Yolanda is planning to use her new loan to purchase cosmetics, clothing, shoes, jewelry, clothing, and other products. She will use her business profits to continue investing in her business and to save for her future and plans. Yolanda will achieve her dream of having a successful business and stable income to support her family. She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, clothing, shoes, jewelry, etc

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.en:
Using the manure from his pigs and dairy cows, Aurelio will feed his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester in order to produce potent biofertilizer, greatly reducing and perhaps eliminating his need to buy commercial fertilizer. By shifting to biofertilizer, Aurelio will dramatically reduce the amount he spends on cultivating his crops. His family of 11 will also benefit from the biogas generated by the biodigester in the kitchen and shower, reducing their LP gas usage.

This Kiva loan will help Aurelio cover 65% of the system price.

loans.use: to purchase an eight-cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Yelian Group

texts.fr: YELIAN est un groupe constitué de neuf personnes qui résident dans le même quartier et dont la présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est nommée Sophie Egnonkè. Dans le but d'augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Sophie Egnonkè n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Sophie Egnonkè est âgée 42 ans et est mariée à un certain Lucien. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont un reste à leur charge. Sophie Egnonkè vit ensemble avec son enfant et son mari et assure avec son mari les charges de la maison. Afin d’assurer un mieux être à son enfant qui reste à charge, Sophie Egnonkè vend de la bouillie (faite à base de la farine de blé) à son domicile. Sophie Egnonkè s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la troisième fois que Sophie Egnonkè et son groupe YELIAN sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt permettra certainement à Sophie Egnonkè et aux autres membres de son groupe de rehausser le niveau de leur activité par l’augmentation du stock de leurs produits et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu. Les deux premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
YELIAN is a group made up of nine members who live in the same neighborhood and whose president (the one with her hand raised in the photo) is named Sophie Egnonkè. With the goal of growing their working capital, this group is requesting a loan from ALIDé. 

Sophie Egnonkè did not attend school. She is 42 and married to Lucien. The couple have four children of whom one is still living under their roof. Sophie Egnonkè lives together with her child and her husband and does her share, together with her husband, to cover their household expenses. So as to ensure the well-being of the child who is still under their care, Sophie Egnonkè sells porridge (made with wheat flour) out of her home. 

Sophie Egnonkè buys her supplies in a Bénin marketplace. This is the third time that Sophie Egnonkè and her group called YELIAN are requesting a loan from ALIDé. This loan will certainly permit Sophie Egnonkè and the other members of her group to expand their businesses by adding to their stock of merchandise and growing their clientele and their income. Their first two loans have been correctly reimbursed.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour and sugar

loans.name: Saffa

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Saffa.  He is married and has four children aged 12, 9, and 6 years old, and the last child is 4 months old. 

In 2008, Saffa established his clothing and shoes business. He began his business because he wanted to engage himself in income generating activity after he dropped out of school and that is his only source of survival. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about Le 970,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Saffa has already received and successfully repaid a loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy jeans, trousers, men's shirts, traveling boxes, and shoes. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Saffa plans to build a house, to start running to Dubai, and to educate his children.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothing and shoes

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma will use her Sistema Biobolsa biodigestor to reduce her reliance on expensive and non-renewable LP gas and agrochemical fertilizers by processing the manure from her dairy cows to produce biogas and biofertilizer, helping both her wallet and the environment. The resulting reduction in operating costs will allow her to better deal with the fluctuating and unpredictable milk prices and make it easier for Norma and her kids to continue the generations-old tradition of dairy farming in the Tecamachalco-region of Puebla.

This Kiva loan will help her cover 95% of the system price.

loans.use: To purchase an 8 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: César

texts.en:
César's Sistema Biobolsa biodigester will help him become more self-sufficient, allowing him to rely less on expensive and non-renewable LP gas and agrochemical fertilizers by shifting to renewable biogas and biofertilizer. As his livelihood is based entirely on the income generated by selling dairy products to intermediaries, reducing his overall costs will allow César to better deal with fluctuating milk prices. His biodigester will convert the cow manure he already has into fuel and fertilizer, turning waste into resources, while reducing César’s carbon footprint.

This Kiva loan will help him cover 56% of the system price.

loans.use: To purchase a 12-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco and his family will use their Sistema Biobolsa biodigester to reduce their non-renewable energy usage. With 10 members in his family, Francisco spends a lot of money on energy needs. Using the biogas produced by his 8-cubic-meter biodigester will allow Francisco to dramatically reduce the amount he spends on fuel for cooking and heating bathwater. As his farm is dedicated to raising pigs and cattle, Francisco will also use the biodigester to process his animal waste resulting in a powerful biofertilizer while reducing or eliminating odors and flies. 

This Kiva loan will help him cover 95% of the system price.

loans.use: To purchase an 8-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.en:
Marcelo will use the biogas generated by his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester to produce cheese. A dairy farmer and cheese maker, Marcelo finds himself spending a lot of money on non-renewable LP gas due to the heat required in the production process. By using the biogas generated by his 12-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester he will reduce his costs and carbon footprint. With the same cow manure used to produce the biogas, he will get a potent biofertilizer to use on his alfalfa and maize crops. As a result, the biodigester will allow him to make cheese heated using biogas with milk from cows eating feed fertilized with their own processed manure – a web of sustainability.

This Kiva loan will help him cover 81% of the system price.

loans.use: To purchase a 12-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Jesusdjro Group

texts.fr: JESUSDJRO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe, Jeanne Kpokpogbé (qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 51 ans. Jeanne Kpokpogbé est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Christophe. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés dont deux restent à leur charge. Jeanne Kpokpogbé vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure avec son mari les charges de la maison. Depuis dix neuf ans environs, Jeanne Kpokpogbé vend divers produits (pain, vin de palme et huile végétale) à son domicile. Jeanne Kpokpogbé s'approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Jeanne Kpokpogbé s’associe avec les autres membres du groupe JESUSDJRO pour consentir un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les quatre premiers crédits reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
JESUSDJRO is a group of three persons, who live in the same neighborhood and belong to the same "merry-go-round" (rotating loan) group. The representative of the group,  Jeanne Kpokpogbé (who is raising her hand in the photo) is 51 years old. Jeanne Kpokpogbé is married to a driver named Christophe. The couple have six children, all having been enrolled in school, of whom two are still living under their roof. 

Jeanne Kpokpogbé lives together with her children and her husband and shares with her husband the responsibility of the household expenses. For about 19 years, Jeanne Kpokpogbé has been selling various products (bread,  palm wine, and vegetable oil) out of her home. She buys her wares in a region of Bénin. 

Wishing to bolster her business and satisfy the demand of her clientele, Jeanne Kpokpogbé came together with the other members of the group called JESUSDJRO to request a fifth loan from ALIDé. Their first four loans have been correctly reimbursed.

loans.use: to buy loaves of bread and jerrycans of palm wine and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials (metals).

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en: Carlos is requesting this loan to buy a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, which turns organic waste, such as maunure from his pigs and sheep, into fertilizer and renewable energy. He wants to do this because he and and his family are being negatively affected by the rising costs of fertilizer and liquid propane gas. As farming is their only source of income, they are constantly seeking lower production costs. The biodigester will dramatically reduce the amount of agrochemical fertilizer they use on their maize, alfalfa, sorghum, and pepper crops while also decreasing their non-renewable LP gas use in the kitchen and shower. This Kiva loan will help him cover 55 percent of the system's price.

loans.use: to buy a machine which turns organic waste into fertilizer and renewable fuel.

loans.name: José Marcelo

texts.en:
José’s Sistema Biobolsa biodigester will use the manure from his pigs, cattle, and goats to produce biofertilizer and biogas.  The shift from non-renewable LP gas and agrochemical fertilizers to the biogas and biofertilizer produced by the biodigester will enable José to dramatically reduce the costs of his farm operations. 

José will apply the biofertilizer on his alfalfa, maize, bean, and oatmeal crops, reducing or eliminating his agrochemical fertilizer usage. The biogas will be used to supplant the LP gas necessary to cook for his family of seven.

This Kiva loan will help him cover 55% of the system price.

loans.use: To buy an 8 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en: Adelina is 23 years old, married and the mother of two children, one of whom is in primary school. Her husband works as a farmer, while she runs a kiosk where she supplies people in her village with basic goods. She also grows vegetables on a small plot of land she owns. Adelina is requesting this loan to buy additional items to sell in her store, including animals such as chickens. She started this business last year with $200 of her own capital. She lives in her simple house where the roof is made of zinc and the walls of palm branches. Her goal for the future is to expand the size of her store.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell from her store, including animals such as chickens.

loans.name: Wangninagbe 5 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANGNINAGBE 5 est composé de trois personnes qui appartiennent à une même association d’artisans. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. Le représentant du groupe, du nom de Danton Pierre est celui qui a la main levée sur la photo. Danton Pierre n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Danton Pierre est âgé de 39 ans et est marié à une marchande du nom de Pierrette. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a trois autres enfants à charge. Danton Pierre vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Danton Pierre exerce la couture depuis près de dix huit ans dans son atelier. Afin de renforcer ses matériels de travail dans le but de faire face à sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Danton Pierre sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe WANGNINAGBE 5. Ce crédit leur permettra surement à rehausser le niveau de leur activité et à se faire plus de profits. Les deux premiers crédits reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group called WANGNINAGBE 5 is made up of three persons who are part of the same association of artisans. It's the third time that this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé, in order to expand the level of their activities. The representative of the group, Danton Pierre, is the one raising his hand in the photo. 

Danton Pierre did not attend school. He is 39 and married to a merchant named Pierrette. The couple have four children, all enrolled in school and in their parents' care. Besides their biological children, the couple have three other children in their care. 

Danton Pierre lives together with his wife and children. The various household expenses are catered for by the couple. To manage his share, Danton Pierre has been working n his sewing workshop for almost 18 years. Wishing to add to his work equipment so that he can keep up with his ever-growing clientele, Danton Pierre is requesting a third loan from ALIDé, together with the other members of the group called WANGNINAGBE 5. This loan will surely allow them to raise the level of their businesses and make more profit. Their first two loans have been correctly reimbursed.

loans.use: to buy a machine.

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es:
Sarita tiene 30 años, tiene un hijo de 8 años, a quien cuida con mucho amor. Su casa es rústica y está ubicada en una comunidad nativa de la selva central.
Desde que tenía 17 años trabajaba en los cultivos de sus padres, desde entonces cultiva café y plátanos. Pero hace 4 años ya vive independientemente con su hijo, por ello produce en dos parcelas café y plátanos. Con las ventas puede asegurar a su hijo una educación y cubrir sus gastos prioritarios. Cuando el trabajo en el campo cesa, en los meses de noviembre se encarga de elaborar viveros de café, “invierto en abono, semilla y bolsas especiales, pero sale a cuenta cuando se vende”, menciona. Sarita vende cada bolsa con una plantita a 40 céntimos. Sus planes futuros son de renovar algunas plantas de café que quedaron débiles por la última cosecha, por eso invertirá en bolsas de abono y en el pago para la limpieza de sus cultivos.

Este es su crédito número 4 con MFP, por eso se compromete, una vez más, en pagar con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Naranjales”, donde es una socia activa y partícipe.
Invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de cinco bolsas de fertilizantes (con 700 soles). Lo restante será para pagar la limpieza de su cafetal.
texts.en:
Sarita is 30 years old and has an eight year old son whom she cares for with a lot of love.  Her home is rustic and located in a native community in the central jungle.  

Since the age of 17 and up until four years ago she had been working in agriculture, mainly coffee and plantains, with her parents.  Since then she has been living independently with her son producing coffee and plantains on two parcels of land.  With her sales she is able to secure an education for her son and cover her primary expenses.  

When work in the field ceases, in November, she is responsible for developing coffee nurseries.  She mentions, "I invest in fertilizer, seeds, and special bags but I only see a return when they sell."  Sarita sells each bag with a seedling at 40 cents.  Her future plans are to regenerate some of the coffee plants that were weak the last harvest.  This is why she will invest in fertilizer and the harvesting of her crops.  

This will be her fourth credit with MFP.  This is why she once again promises to pay her monthly bills on time.  She belongs to the communal bank "Los Naranjales" where she is an active member and participant.  She will invest the money in the purchase of five bags of fertilizer (with 700 Sols).  The remainder will go towards the harvesting of her crops.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and to pay for the harvesting of her coffee crops.

loans.name: Agusta

texts.en:
Agusta is 23 years old and married.  Her husband works for a local NGO called Belun (which means friends), and they have one child. 

Agusta has a kiosk in front of her home to supply people in her village with basic goods. She will purchase additional supplies for her store with the loan, including flour, oil, soap, and animals, like chickens, goats, and pigs.  She opened her kiosk one year ago with a working capital of 200. 

She hopes with the income, she can support their children and help them to get a good education.

loans.use: To buy needed items including flour, oil, soap, and animals.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is 38 years old and married, with two children, both in school.  Her husband is a police officer. 

Herminia has a kiosk.   She is requesting a loan of US $1,000 to purchase additional supplies for her store, including flour, oil, soap, and rice. She opened her kiosk one year ago with a working capital of US $300.

loans.use: To buy flour, oil, soap, rice, and other items for her kiosk.

loans.name: Emalin

texts.en: Emalin is 40 years old and lives in San Vicente, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur with her husband and four children. She earns a living by planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been in this business for 15 years and earns PHP 8,500 a month. She joined GDMPC in 2007, and is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her farm to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Karina Janeth

texts.es:
Karina tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera. Se dedica a la venta de comida como: pollo, carne, arroz, pescado, ensalada, refresco, sodas y demás productos comestibles. También vende antojitos como: yuca frita y salcochada, panes con pollo, hamburguesas, etc. Estos productos los vende en una zona de mucho comercio en horarios de 11:00 a.m. a 4:30 p.m. antes de establecer el negocio ella se dedicaba a estudiar.

La materia prima tales como el pollo, arroz, carne, pescado, verdura para ensalada, etc. para la elaboración de sus comidas, las adquiere en un mercado que esta a tres kilómetros de su casa.

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar 10 libras de pollo, 10 libras de carne, 10 libras de pescado, verduras, 30 gallinas indias para elaborar los sabrosos panes de gallina india, 2 mesas y 8 sillas plásticas. Con la inversión aumentara el inventario, para disponer de más variedad de comida a la vista y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, ya que la demanda es bastante grande, por lo que espera incrementar los ingresos; para solicitar a la Alcaldía Municipal de la ciudad un puesto de venta al interior del mercado de la municipalidad y así establecer bien su negocio, comprar mobiliario para que sus clientes puedan degustar su comida ahí mismo y no le pidan para llevar.
texts.en:
Karina is 21 years old and single. She sells food such as chicken, meat, rice, fish, salad, soft drinks, pop, and other edible products. She also sells snacks such as fried or boiled yucca, chicken sandwiches, hamburgers etc. She sells these items in a busy commercial area between 11 am and 4:30 pm. Before starting this business, she was a student.

Karina buys the ingredients for the meals (chicken, rice, fish, salad greens etc.) from a market which is three km from her house.

The loan she is seeking will be used to buy 10 lb of chicken, 10 lb of meat, 10 lb of fish, vegetables, 30 whole chickens to make her tasty chicken dishes, two tables and eight plastic chairs. This investment will provide her with more stock so that she can offer her customers a greater variety of food and satisfy their wishes. Demand for the food is high so Karina expects to earn more income. She will also use the loan money to ask for a stall in the interior of the market from the Municipality and put her business on a sound footing. As well she wishes to buy furniture so that her customers will enjoy eating the food on the premises instead of asking for take-out.

loans.use: buy the ingredients for the meals (chicken, rice, fish, salad greens etc.), 2 tables and 8 chairs

loans.name: Sayda

texts.es: La señora Sayda de 30 años de edad conviviente con el señor Sabino más de 15 años, con 3 hijos dependientes que están estudiando, viven en área rural comunidad de Huancuni hacia el norte de Colomi, Doña Sayda se dedica a la producción agrícola tiene ingresos económicos de lo que vende papa, haba, oca, papaliza, de esta forma ella mantiene a sus hijos, la señora Sayda necesita un crédito para obra fina de su vivienda en Sacaba que la hizo construir recientemente y no le alcanzo por que el ahorro que tenía invirtió todo en la obra gruesa, además en otras Entidades Financieras resulta que les pidieron muchos requisitos para sacar un préstamo, como también nos cuenta que su esposo viajo a trabajar al extranjero (Argentina) hasta fines de este año ya que tuvieron mucho gasto últimamente y así van a poder mantener el estudio de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sayda is 30 years old and has lived together with her partner Sabino for more than 15 years and has three dependent children who are studying in school.  They live in a rural community called Huancuni in the northern part of Colomi. Sayda works in the field of agriculture and makes a living through the sales of potatoes, broad beans, and other traditional tubers, called oca and papaliza in order to provide for her children.  

Sayda needs this loan because she wants to do the finish work on her house in Sacaba, which they started building recently and never finished because they had invested all of their savings in the major construction, and also because in other financial institutions they ask for a lot of collateral to get a loan, and she also says that her husband traveled to go work in another country (Argentina) until the end of they year, since they have had many expenses lately and this will allow them to keep their children in school.

loans.use: for good construction of her house.

loans.name: Changement De Meyak 1 & 3 Group

texts.fr:
Poligene habite dans la ville Meyak d’Haïti où de l’électricité n’existe pas et l’eau est très limitée.

Poligène a dirigé son commerce du Charbon pendant les dernières 11 années. Avant de commencer ce commerce, Elle était un professeur

Poligène voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir au commerce du charbon et de bois. Poligène utiliser le prêt pour investir et faire croître votre entreprise.

Les autres membres de Changement de Meyak ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre du charbon, du riz et des vetements uses
texts.en:
Poligène lives in the town of Meyak, in Haiti, where there is no electricity and where the water supply is very limited.

She has been managing a charcoal business for the past 11 years.  Before starting this business, she was a teacher.

She would like to use this loan to invest in the business of charcoal and wood and to expand her activity.

The other members of the group "Changement de Meyak" need a loan to finance such activities such as selling charcoal, rice and used clothes.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and wood.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Ailene is from Kapatagan, Lanao del Sur. She is 34 years old. Ailene is married and has two children. 

To make a living, Ailene makes and sells a variety of snack foods/items in the local community. Ailene has been in her business for two years and earns PHP 2,800 a month for these activities. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients she needs to make products for sale. 

In 2011, Ailene joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to make her snack foods for sale.

loans.name: Made

texts.en: Made is 36 years old and lives in Melaya, West Bali. She is married and has two children, aged 13 and 9. Her daughter is in the fourth grade and her son is in his second year of junior high school. Her husband is a farmer. For the last 10 years, she has earned a living by raising piglets, and is now seeking a loan for 11,000 IDR from MUK to expand her business. She will use this loan to buy piglets, a sow and feed for them to eat, as well as build a barn for her animals. With her earnings, she hopes to be able to pay her children's school fees and buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy piglets, a sow and feed, and build a barn for her animals.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en: Celia is 48 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines with her husband and three children. For the last six years, she has earned a living by selling snacks. She earns PHP 3,500 a month, and is requesting a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy more of the ingredients she needs to make products to sell. Celia joined GDMPC last year, and hopes to use the additional income she earns to expand her business and save for the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make snacks to sell.

loans.name: Reina Elizabeth

texts.es:
Reina, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos quienes ya son adultos, la venta de las tortillas la administra como una fuente para atraer ingresos a la familia, es la manera de subsistir que tiene reina.

Solicita un préstamo para poder realizar la compra de maíz, leña, y algunos utensilios plásticos, que son necesarios para almacenar las tortillas, este préstamo le ayudara con los recursos económicos que necesita y poderlos invertir en los materiales para el negocio, aumentando así la producción de las tortillas.

Su objetivo es mejorar sus ingresos a través del fortalecimiento del negocio y del uso de este préstamo.
texts.en:
Reina makes a living selling tortillas.  She lives with her husband and two sons who are now adults.  The sale of tortillas is how her family makes an income - it is how Reina supports them.  

She is seeking a loan to purchase corn, wood, and plastic utensils which are necessary to store the tortillas.  This loan will provide Reina the economic resources necessary to invest in supplies thus increasing tortilla production.  

Her objective is to increase her income by strengthening her business with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase corn, wood, and plastic utensils.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar is an artisan who specializes in tooled leather home accents. He would like to purchase raw materials such as high quality leather, wood, and dye to expand production.

Oscar has been selling through NOVICA since 2004. This is his story:

When Oscar was 10 years old his father died, leaving him no choice but to work at different jobs. One day, when he was 12, he came upon a carpentry shop where he discovered his love for working with wood and leather. He resolved to master the craft, and he did so on his own, learning each step and improving every detail. Today, Oscar has his own workshop. He sees his work as an art form, and not just something to be sold. His says his work fills his life in a way he cannot explain.

"Thank you very much for being a part of this interest-free microcredit project in support of artisans. We don't have big factories and we don't have big machines. We practically do everything with our hands. There are periods where we fall on hard times, so I am happy to know there are people such as you out there who will heed our call."

Use the link below to view Oscar's tooled leather creations on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=4344

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for his tooled leather crafts in order to expand production

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is 34 years old and married, with four children. 

She runs a retail store to earn extra income. She started operating this five years ago and keeps it going. She earns PHP 4,000 a month. She is borrowing PHP 5,000, which she will use to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee. 

She hopes that this investment will make sense and help improve her business operations.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
